direction.raw_text: : Snow swirls around the tall buildings of downtown Chicago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cars, taxis, limos line the street. A cab pulls up and MAN in tuxedo moves into:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: arriving guests we PICK UP the Man climbing stairs to the ballroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Man hands his coat to coat check woman and thanks her. When he turns we get our first view of DR. RICHARD KIMBLE, a tall, athletic man, with a trim beard. He moves from the outer lobby into a fabulously decorated ballroom where a fashion show is taking place as a medical fundraiser. Doctors and their spouses, hospital brass and sponsors mingle. Women sit near the runway watching the models. Men talk by the bar. The room is packed. A banner over the rostrum says: "CHILDREN'S RESEARCH AND AID FOUNDATION" Kimble is handed a glass of champagne, which he promptly sets on another waiter's passing tray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROBERTS, a large surgeon, pulls Kimble over to a group of surgeons gathered around a bar. Smoking cigars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cancun. Nat just talked everybody into it... A hospital equipment rep, NAT, is buying drinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, what's the deal? If the hospital buys ten new -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, no, no strings attached, Dr. Kimble. Industrial Hospital Supply has no ulterior motives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the house, huh? (to bartender) Tonic water with lime. Everyone agrees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never get me to sell my soul for one of those trips... His tone silences the group. Kimble takes his drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... But if you get any more Bulls tickets, Nat, give me a call. The group laughs, Kimble extracts himself and CREDITS CONTINUE OVER -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moving through the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nearly gets hit in the follow-through of an imaginary golf swing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're slicing, Dave. Don't turn your hip. He keeps moving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Richard...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: totally out of her element amid the formal elegance around her. She wears a leather jacket over T-shirt and stares at the action on the fashion runway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so glad you talked me into coming, Richard... I can pick my cruise wardrobe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's for a good cause, Kath... Besides you need to get out of the lab more. Your electron microscope is starting to give you a tan. She smiles. He moves on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble continues down the bar when he spots a friend...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Jim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JAMES NICHOLS turns, smiles. Mid-40s, head of the University Hospital. He is a fit contemporary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard, I just saw someone who wanted to meet you... Just then Kimble spots an attractive WOMAN, late thirties, wearing a drop-dead, simple black gown. She's surrounded by a group of men hanging on her every word. She and Kimble catch a look and hold it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard Kimble... Alex Lentz. Alex is working on the RDU90 trials for Devlin-Macgregor. Kimble turns to meet DR. ALEXANDER LENTZ, late 30s, tan, smiling. Lentz extends his hand...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Kimble... Sorry, we've been trading phone calls last few days ... something about a biopsy report I returned to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... Three. Livers appeared hepatetic to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be in my office in the morning and I'll pull up the samples. Is that a good time for you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See you, Jim. Lentz moves on. Kimble looks after him a beat, then focuses on relocating the Woman he just saw. She's gone. He and Nichols move together through the party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before I forget, I went by the garage this afternoon and picket up the Ferrari. Thanks for the loaner again. He hands Kimble a valet ticket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They fix it this time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll see. They reach the Woman Kimble saw, his wife, HELEN KIMBLE. Kimble kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look fabulous, Helen. He kisses Helen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Jim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got a court tomorrow at three. Nichols leaves. Kimble looks at his wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I've seen everyone, can we leave?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That would be a little abrupt, don't you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A table for ten. Kimble and Helen introduce themselves to others at table ant sit across from each other. Kimble sits between two doctors' wives. One, NOW EAU WIFE, mid-thirties, bedecked in jewels and loud dress, the other OLDER WIFE. Helen sits between their husbands who are trying to impress her with the details of their boring studies as CREDITS CONTINUE...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WITH the fashion, catches of dialog and course changes, Kimble and Helen demonstrate an oft-used exchange of glances: Kimble, while gracious to his dinner partners, catches Helen's eye and makes smiling, subtle movements to his watch or a look to the door to indicate he's clearly ready to leave. On the receiving end, Helen, the gatekeeper of their social propriety, indicates with equal subtlety: "not yet." As we MOVE AROUND the table we hear: "Where's your husband on staff?" "My husband's an orthopod at Northwestern." "I'm working on a new technique..." "That's fascinating..." "That's quite a marvelous dress you're wearing." "Do you like it? My husband says it's a 'four-fracture number."' "Honey." (A look from her husband.) Kimble shares a look with Helen. He subtly motions to his watch: time go to, and mouths the word: "now." She shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told my husband that he was going to kill us if he didn't stop operating. What with this AIDS thing, he's putting us all at risk. Helen and Kimble absorb this comment without reaction, share a look. Helen mouths the word: "Now."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, I have to get my husband home. They say their good-byes and pass Nichols' table. Nichols shakes his friend's hand in passing. From across the room we see Lentz watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble and Helen driving home. She runs her fingers through his hair as he drives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You looked handsome tonight...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you... He smiles to himself, seems to enjoy the compliment too much for Helen. Her smile becomes playful, mischievous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, huh... most men in a tuxedo look like waiters...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You looked more like... a band director. He stops at red light, leans over and kisses her. Light changes and neither notice. Slowly their kiss breaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we home yet?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble pulls up in front of his house. Suddenly both his PAGER and CAR PHONE RING at the same time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Kimble (suddenly attentive) When? Okay, tell them I'll be there in ten minutes. He hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tim's got a problem. Helen kisses him again, opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call me on your way home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as we -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble, wearing scrubs but without head gear, moves down stairs to the OR hall. He sticks his head into the operating room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cavalry's here. Two harried surgeons look up, glad to see him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble begins scrubbing as the RESIDENT comes out to bring him up to speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Patient is a male, forty-three. We pulled his gall bladder and the bleeding started.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's his pro time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's at 36 seconds. We got a major bleeder in here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You talk to the family?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None. He's off the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Operation in progress. Top medical facility filled with trained professionals and state of the art equipment. Kimble is assisted across the table by the chief Resident. Both working so intently they never look at each other as they talk...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... I'm clamping. Can he tolerate it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a very sick guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do we have a choice?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marie, give me a clamp...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the scrub nurse, passes him the instrument and Kimble and the other SURGEON continue to work with the Resident assisting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your husband know you're here tonight, Marie?... What about this liver?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: History's sketchy. Could be an alcoholic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who referred him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's on a drug protocol. RDU90. Kimble looks up and shares a look with the chief Resident over their masks, then back to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wave of the future... Marie, you told Frank yet? Frank is so jealous of this late night thing we've got going here... This should hold him. Bleeding's stopped. Let's get a biopsy... (to circulating nurse) Send it downstairs and make sure you get Kath her slice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You staying for the closing, Rich? Kimble moves away and sheds his gloves and gown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I got a date.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble throws away his hat and mask. The door opens behind him; it is the other Surgeon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Richard... Kimble turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble driving through empty Chicago streets toward home. He is on phone, waits for answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. I'm five minutes away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen on the phone, downstairs. She is still in her gown with an afghan around her shoulders. She's been reading.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad it went well. I'll see you in a minute. Helen hangs up phone, turns out the light and starts up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble driving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen moves down the hall toward the dressing room/closet. Opens the door to large closet dressing room and turns on the light. Nothing. She starts to leave and decides to close one of the interior closet doors. She starts to slide the door closed when - wham! A hand reaches out and clutches her by the neck. Helen claws and scratches to get free and in her struggle her string of pearls bursts... ... and a single pearl bounces out of the bedroom... rolls across the landing to the stairs, stopping three steps from the top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Snow swirls around the street as Kimble's car pulls into the driveway. On the third floor, we see a bedroom light still on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: softly. Kimble tosses his keys on the entry table, picks up a stack of mail on the table and calls up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm home. Did you hear who won the Bulls game? No answer. He steps into the:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wall phone shows a line in use. Kimble notices it. The WASHER BUZZES, he switches the clothes from washer to dryer, and STARTS the MACHINE. Takes a bottle of wine and two glassesand leaves the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON .38 SMITH AND WESSON - NIGHT Lies on the floor, beside Helen's legs and the receiver of phone, off the hook. A man's rubber-gloved hand picks up the gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble starts up the stairs to the bedroom...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen's hand reaches out presses the cradle down, dials
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Climbing the stairs... suddenly stops. A small white ball on the stairs. He bends down and picks it up... a pearl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen? Silence. He can see directly into the bedroom. It's quiet. Too quiet. He notices a lampshade on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble moves slowly to the opened doorway. And just before he enters he sees a large form in the crack behind the door. Adrenal surge. Kimble slams the door back on the figure knocking the gun free. Before Kimble can move to it a forearm flattens him. The attacker immediately goes for the gun. Kimble grabs a leg and twists him down, the man's fingers hit the gun, sending it skittering across the hardwood floor of the landing and over the edge - three flights to the entry hall below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: can be heard. Distant but APPROACHING. The man kicks free and tries to flee. This time Kimble catches an arm and twists it at an unnatural angle. To his shock, the limb detaches between the shoulder and elbow. Kimble looks at the arm in his hands - it's hollow. Electrodes are visible inside - then to the man's unreadable face... The SIRENS are LOUDER... Before Kimble can recover, the One-Armed Man knocks Kimble down and grabs back his arm. He runs down the stairs. Kimble pulls himself up and starts to follow but is stopped by a VOICE behind him in the bedroom...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's here... still in the house...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lying by the bed, Helen Kimble, clutches the phone with one hand, her head with the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I hear you right? Your attacker is still in the house? Ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's trying to kill me... Kimble appears. Helen drops the phone when she sees him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you repeat that please?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard... He's trying to kill me... my head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two Chicago police cars wheel to the curb, COPS move quickly to the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble moves to her. Sees the necklace of bruises where she was held down and choked. And then a bullet wound in her leg. She's already going into shock. Her speech turns thick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hang on, babe... going to be all right. Her fingernails dig into Kimble's arm, trying to hold on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My head. Richard my hold me. Her eyes slip away from his. He peels away the hand on her head - and sees raw pummeled brain staring back and realizes she won't be all right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the dropped phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Hello. You said his name is Richard? Ma'am, can you talk to me? Ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Cops enter the house. See the .38 lying on the floor. Covering each other, they move quickly up the stairs - guns drawn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Third floor. The First Cop, gun drawn, turns the corner of Kimble's bedroom and finds: Kimble holding his dead wife. Blood on his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Move away from her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble, numbed by the event, washes the blood off his hands in the kitchen sink. A cop takes his blood-stained tux jacket, and another hands him a parka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The street is filled with Chicago police cars, curious neighbors, television news vans, etc. Kimble is helped into a police car as the coroner's van arrives. He pauses a moment to watch as we hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you give us a little more to go on besides the fact that he had an artificial arm? What kind of gun was it, Doc?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble in an interview room. He is in "why" shock. "Why her." "Why me?" Says nothing. Two Detectives: KELLY and ROSETTI. Kelly, the questioner, is overweight, aggressive. He shifts his gun on his hip so he can sit down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was .38... I think. I only saw it for a second. I knocked it out of his hand. As Kimble is questioned we INTERCUT WITH flashes of the murder scene being processed:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. KIMBLE'S HOUSE - NIGHT Forensics technicians photograph the .38 at the base of the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you own a gun, Dr. Kimble?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of gun?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .38 Smith.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: FORENSICS TECHNICIAN DUSTS CRYSTAL LAMP DETECTIVE KELLY

direction.raw_text: - FORENSICS TECHNICIAN DUSTS CRYSTAL LAMP DETECTIVE KELLY Did you have your key with you tonight, Dr. Kimble?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - COPS Checking doors of house for signs of forcible entry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Rosetti answers it. Kimble watches him write something down, he slides it to Kelly.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: MEASURE "NECKLACE" OF BRUISES ON HELEN'S NECK DETECTIVE KELLY

direction.raw_text: - MEASURE "NECKLACE" OF BRUISES ON HELEN'S NECK DETECTIVE KELLY (V.O.) Your wife was loaded wasn't she? I mean, she was worth quite a bit of money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble looks up at the two cops. For the first time he seems to sense something aggressive in their questioning. They no longer seem on the same team.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on here? This guy was trying to rob us. The two cops stare at Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys have got to be out of your minds. I didn't kill my wife! He gets up to go. A cop blocks his path. He turns and looks at Kelly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's start over, Dr. Kimble. What'd you have for breakfast?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 11TH ST. POLICE STATION - NIGHT Kimble in his tuxedo shirt and black tie holds a booking number plate in front of him as a mug shot is taken... front, then side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're all adults here so I'll lay it out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chicago Sun-Times has a photograph of Kimble spread across the front page.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... If you two come up with a deal, I'll listen, but let me make one thing perfectly clear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Salesmen continue to hawk sets. Kimble's photograph comes up on a hundred TV monitors across the store.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Police are revealing no details in the case against Chicago surgeon...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble lays on his bunk. Thinking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... It's an election year...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smoke-fillet room to find tough FEMALE PROSECUTOR, a man in late forties, WALTER GUTHERIE, and STOPS ON the source of the voice we've been hearing and the cigar: JUDGE BENNETT, late fifties. Fair but, no nonsense, political survivor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and this case is a heater. It will not end up a bench trial...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard Kimble in County lockup fatigues and a navy watch cap moves down long corridor, escorted by GUARD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've had private investigators interview over a hundred amputees, Richard...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter Gutherie, his attorney, stands by a window looking out at the yard. Another attorney, RANDOLPH, watches Gutherie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... We can't find this guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what I saw, Walter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I put you up on the stand to say what you saw without anything that remotely smells like proof and the State's attorney is going to take this one-armed man story and run it up our ass. (he holds Kimble's look) Look, Richard, you're paying us a lot of money to defend you... A plea to second degree -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't kill my wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble being escorted back to the courtroom. A guard carries his suit in a bag. He is taunted by other prisoners.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a successful upper middle class white man charged in a violent crime...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the other side of the door is the courtroom. A sheriff's deputy hands Kimble (now wearing his suit), a small plastic bag. In it we see his wedding band.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a circumstantial case, but it's also a jury trial. We play 'em, they play 'em...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard Kimble sits at defense table... watches prosecutors chat with Helen's relatives. Media anchors glare at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... But if we lose, we lose big. Just remember, they're lined up a block long to have your hide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A crime scene photograph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No forcible entry was found. From the beginning of the investigation, it did not appear to be a break-in. Nothing was missing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The defendant's prints were found on the neck, gun, bullets, and lamp... no other sets were fount other than the deceased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Impassive. Attentive. His "peers." They listen to the recording of the 911 tape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I hear you right? Your attacker is still in the house? Ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's trving to kill me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you repeat that please?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard... He's trying to kill me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few members lean over to make notes. It's powerful taken out of context.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Nichols. You are aware that Richard Kimble was the only beneficiary of Helen Kimble's estate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: million dollars roughly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was aware of that. The money meant nothing to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yet in your presence, Richard Kimble once said that 'if he had Helen's money he could find plenty of uses.' Did he not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were talking about -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes or no? Nichols' look tells us everything... Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wound to the head caused a massive hemorrhage to the brain. It took from five to seven minutes for her to die... A woman in the jury reacts. Kimble notices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the stand. He finishes his moving description of the events. We see some of the jury has been moved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... And I was holding her when the officers came in. Gutherie returns to his seat. The Prosecutor moves to the jury. He begins slowly but his questions pick up strength.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How tall was this man, Dr. Kimble?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't be sure. We were, mostly on the floor, fighting... I couldn't -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did that fight cause the scratches on your face and arms?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. As I explained -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how did this man enter your house?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you probably don't know why your wife told the emergency operator You were her attacker?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She didn't -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your name is Richard, isn't it? Your gun is a .38, isn't it? Your prints were on the gun, the bullets, the lamp, her neck, weren't they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weren't they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard Kimble sits behind the desk, but already he's a shadow of the man we knew before, stares ahead passively as Judge Bennett delivers the sentencing to hushed courtroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After careful and studied review of all evidence presented during each phase of this proceeding, and because aggravated circumstances, detailed at length, were present the night of January 20th. Kimble is silent, stunned, but all around him the sentence shockwaves through the courtroom. Reporters push out rear doors. Prosecutors share a look - with a hangman's satisfaction. Nichols, watching behind Kimble's table, lowers his head. Disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He remains silent. Kimble is pulled gently to his feet by bailiff. Gutherie whispers an "I'm sorry." Kimble doesn't hear it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Therefore, it is the decision of this court... Looks over his shoulder to the emptying courtroom. Faces stare back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Judge Bennett's V.O. CONTINUES over: A locker opening. Inside, a profusion of chrome and nickel plating. Jailhouse jewelry. Handcuffs dragged out. Action checked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... that you be remanded to Menard State penitentiary...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slapped down over wrists, ratcheting down tight. Ankle cuffs dragged out. Pant legs raised, canvas shoes exposed. Cuffs clamped down on ankles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: out. Snaked across the floor. Looped around waists and locked to handcuffs to form belly chains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... where you will serve a sentence of life imprisonment without possibility of parole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SALLY PORT (COOK COW TY JAIL) - NIGHT The chain gang exits through the sally port. Kimble and three other prisoners. Jailers escort them to... An Illinois Department of Corrections guard moves alongside, checking the undercarriage with a pole-mounted mirror. The GAVEL CRACKS as we -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Locking wire mesh cage inside bus. An old DIESEL COUGHS to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Main gates open. The BUS GRINDS onto the streets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The four prisoners sit scattered, still cuffed but no longer chained together. Near the front, PRISONER #1 is eyeing... The two prison guards seated beyond the caged door. YOUNG GUARD lighting a smoke. OLD GUARD drowsing. Shotguns bouncing on their knees. Prisoner #l shifts his gaze to... The driver. Pistol on his hip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BUS RUMBLES north, heading towards the horizon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 rises. Through caging:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Illinois penal regulations require a meal for transport rides of four hours or more. Young Guard shakes his head. "Fucking jailhouse lawyers." Checks his watch: 4:00.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack! Feedin' time. Old Guard yawns to his feet, unhooks a key-ring from his belt. Young Guard stows his shotgun in the weapons locker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #2 looks at Kimble. Kimble stirs awake... watches the cage door open, Young Guard moving back. And across the aisle...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #3, a big man named COPELAND, wags his head between his knees. Something slides out of his shirt and CLANKS to the dimpled steel floor. It's a razor sharp plastic shank. Heart quickening, Kimble looks forward. Young Guard is handing a petrified sandwich to Prisoner #1. Kimble snaps a look back to Copeland, who palms the shank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Breathe, and you're first. Old Guard watches from the open cage door, shotgun carelessly ready. Young Guard reaches Kimble and extends a sandwich. Kimble doesn't respond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suit yourself. He offers the sandwich to Copeland. In the exchange, sandwich drops. Copeland leans down for it. Up front, Old Guard yawns again just as...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look out! Too late... Jackknifing up, Copeland drives the shank into Young Guard's gut. Prisoner #2 dives for Young Guard's holster. As the gun comes out, Young Guard gets a hand on it. A SHOT FIRES... Jolting Old Guard. He chambers his shotgun. Kimble hits the floor. The Old Guard jams a key into the cage door and surges inside, but... Prisoner #1 broadsides Old Guard. SHOTGUN DISCHARGES... Opening a big Gainsburger hole in the driver. He sinks under the steering wheel. A knee hits the accelerator. The CAGE DOOR SLAMS locked behind the Old Guard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the bus careens off the road, accelerating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Young Guard wrestles gun from Prisoner #2 and FIRES, killing prisoner #2. Copeland grapples with wounded Young Guard. Old Guard shotgun-butts Prisoner #1, flips the gun, PUMPS ONE ROUND into the man's chest. Dead. He turns just as...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the driverless BUS BUCKS ant BANGS over open ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old Guard reloads. Copeland drops down behind a seat. Old Guard jams his SHOTGUN under the seat. But just as the Old Guard pulls the trigger the bus jerks. The SHOT goes off target as...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BUS ROARS into a gravel embankment. ROARS up the slope and CRASHES down on its side - sliding to a stop at the bottom of a small ravine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Dusty silence. We don't know up from down. On his knees, Old Guard makes his way to the driver. Finds him dead. Now a SOUND. Old Guard whips his shotgun around at... Kimble. Rising between the seats. A hairy beat. Old Guard might kill him just to finish things off. But a GROAN turns Old Guard's head. Young Guard, trying to hold his guts in. Old Guart turns to find Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You. You're a doctor. C'mere. He slides to the Young Guard as the Old Guard scrounges up a medical kit, shoves Kimble down on Young Guard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do something. Kimble looks at his cuffs. "In these?" Old Guard digs out his key ring and unlocks Kimble's hands - only his hands. Kimble opens medical kit. It's been ransacked - just Band-Aids now. Kimble looks into the wound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He isn't going to make it unless he gets to a hospital. Fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . In this delicate moment a SHIVER runs through the bus. Is it just settling? With other things to worry about, Kimble tries to stop Young Guard's bleeding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see Copeland, alive. The crash has ripped the bars from a back window and shattered the glass. He works to get out the opening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A second SHIVER ripples through the bus, stronger. Kimble retracts his hands to touch a metal panel - and feels a growing vibration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just where the hell are we? The Old Guard feels it too. He gets down on his knees and looks out one of the shattered, barred windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, shit...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bus lies across railroad tracks. A not-too-distant bend grows bright by the light of an approaching train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble sees: Old Guard fights the cage door. Kimble lunges to his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's locked. Where're your keys?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Downtrack, one Cyclops light appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble spots keys. Pitches them to Old Guard. Drags Young Guard to the front for a quick exit. But Old Guard fumbles the key-ring, his hands shaking as much as the bus. The train light spider-webs across cracked windows. Kimble snatches the keys away from the Guard's trembling hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which one? This? This one?! Old Guard gulps a nod. Kimble jams a key in the lock. Throws the door open. Grabs Young Guard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help me get him - But Old Guard climbs right over Kimble's back and climbs out the shattered windshield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Copeland escapes through the hole in the back...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and hits the ground running the other way. The locomotive's headlight reveals the toppled bus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Train light grows. A nanosecond of uncertainty: Should Kimble leave the wounded man? Kimble and the Young Guard hold a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the WHEELS BRAKE and LOCK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble struggles out of the bus - pulling the Young Guard behind him. He slings the man clear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: death, the TRAIN SKIDS closer. For one heartbeat, Kimble remains perched atop the bus. The train light X-rays him. Kimble leaps. Lands. Rolls. Gains his feet. Tries to sprint away but can't: His feet are still chained. He gets off a dozen mincing steps before...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A hundred tons of STEEL SLAMS into the bus, splitting it open. Shrapnel rips through Kimble's thigh, but he stays on his feet, still running feverish half-steps. An EXPLOSION envelops the train. Flames stream down its flanks. The train burns past the wounded Guard. Kimble looks back, expecting to see the catastrophe behind him. But he gets the shock of his life - of any man's life: Still on its wheels, the locomotive is derailing - and coming after him. It's the stuff of nightmares: One little man being chased by a fire-breathing locomotive. The train burrows to a stop. Kimble is suddenly five feet taller, standing on an upheaval of earth, staring eyeball-to-eyeball with the train that nearly devoured him. He pants. Coughs on smoke. Then notices something in his hand. It's the key-ring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble sits and searches the key-ring for manacle key. Suddenly a hand reaches down and snatches the key-ring away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me that. Kimble watches as Copeland quickly unlocks both sets of his own chains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You listen to me. I don't give a damn which way you go, just don't follow me. Kimble takes the key as Copeland wraps his chains around his arm and runs. Kimble unlocks his leg irons and runs in the other direction - crossing a hilltop in the moonlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: News and sheriff's department choppers circle billowing smoke. TILT DOWN to reveal the derailed train. Fire engines hose down the blackened locomotive. Rescue workers work feverishly with jaws-of-life to get into the mangled wreckage. Illuminated by spotlights, transportation investigators in blue coveralls pick through the twisted remains of the bus. State troopers restrain spectators. Two American-made rental cars pull up. Four deputy U.S. marshals emerge:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Swaggering Midwestern carnivore. Built like a brick shithouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Bantam-rooster of a man, no more than 140 pounds fully-equipped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Black woman. Nobody minds having her around during nut-cuttin' time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a scrub-faced G-5. From the second car steps GERARD. He takes in the media spectacle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good lord...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this... a circus? As a group they begin moving along the service road above the crash site. Derailed train cars are accortianed below them. They take in the elements of the crash and as they walk each begins to reveal their U.S. Marshal's credentials. Biggs spots something...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Point of impact. ... and branches off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Biggs, your turn to babysit Newman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit. (to Newman) Come on. They drop down to the crash site. Poole ant Renfro remain with Gerard. A state TROOPER steps into their path, but falls away when he sees Gerard's Marshall star.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How ya doing? Who's in charge?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sheriff Rollins. Just follow the lights - Gerard follows his point to where TV lights illuminate the scene. He shakes his head - it doesn't please him. Renfro and Poole share a look, they seem to know what's about to happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seated near a tree. A space blanket draped over his shoulders. He is surrounded by EMT personnel, and a YOUNG SHERIFF, clearly basking in the event. Television remote news crews are kept only slight back. Gerard appears in the b.g., listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... train was bearin' down on us, fast. I don't know how - it's still kind of hazy - but I grabbed him and pushed him out of the bus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You coulda both been killed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, but hell, he's my partner. Woulda done the same for me. The young Sheriff in charge nods, buying the story. Gerard eases forward, displays his badge, interrupts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, Sheriff Rollins? Deputy U.S. Marshal Samuel Gerard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be with you in a minute. The television lights widen to illuminate Gerard. He shields his eyes. The Sheriff opens a file and produces fax-photos of all four prisoners.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the record. These three dead. And this one... He switches to a photo of Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, everything happened so fast... (bites lip, decides) Huh-uh. Don't think he made it. Sheriff eyes the wreckage that could entomb a hundred prisoners, then files Kimble's fax-photo with the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get some rest. He pats the Guard on the shoulder and approaches Gerard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like you came a long way for nothing. My men've already done a thorough search from point of impact and found nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Biggs and Newman stop by the muddy culvert. Biggs sees something. He orders Newman into the muck after it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aware of media, proceeds patiently with the young Sheriff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With all due respect, may I suggest check-points starting at a 15-mile radius on I-57, I-24, Route 13 east of -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa, whoa, whoa... For what? Prisoners are all dead. The only thing check-points will do is get a lot of good people out here frantic and flood my office with calls. Gerard finally touches eyeballs with the young Sheriff and we get our first taste of Gerard at close range.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, shit, Sheriff, I'd hate for that to happen... So, I'll be taking over the investigation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On whose authority?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By authority of the Governor of the State of Illinois and the office of the United States Marshal, 5th District Northern Illinois... Poole produces State and Federal authorization documents from one of her pockets and hands it to the young Sheriff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. You want jurisdiction over this mess, you got it. (to assistants) Shut it down. Wyatt Earp is here to mop up for us. He slaps the file of fax-photos at Gerard on his way out. Just as Biggs, spotless, eases ino the group with Kimble's manacles. Behind Biggs we see Newman, covered in mud. Seeing the leg irons, the Sheriff and his deputies pile to a stop. Now Gerard takes his run at Old Guard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, ladies and gentlemen, step back and give this poor man some room. Like an obedient dog the press backs off, they sense a change of story and command. Gerard kneels down with Poole and Renfro in front of the Old Guard. The Sheriff hovers near.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Always an interesting thing when we find leg irons and no legs in them who held the keys, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you be so kind as to show them to me, sir? Gerard's large hand extends palm up at the Old Guard. The Old Guard pats his pockets, comes up empty. He eyes the press hovering just out of earshot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Second chance. Poole reopens the file of photos in front of the man. The Old Guard can't take it - points to Kimble's photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He mighta got out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell is this? A minute ago you tell me he's part of the wreckage, now you're -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renfro - Take that bus apart. I want an accurate body count. Poole - Set up operations right here. He stops and looks into the TV lights and starts moving downtrack. The media and State Police move with him like Israelites behind Moses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ladies and gentlemen... our fugitive's been on the run for ninety minutes. Average foot speed over uneven ground - barring injury is approximately four miles an hour, giving us a radius of six miles. I want a hard-target search of any residence, gas station, farmhouse, henhouse, doghouse and outhouse in that area. Check-points go up at 15 miles. (to media) You got that? Good. Now, turn those damn things off and get out of our way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... just above the treetops. Helicopter speeds up a dark river. Its tracking beam illuminates the river bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flashing lights. Two highway patrol cars set up roadblocks. The SQUAWK of police RADIOS breaks the rural quiet. A moment later a HELICOPTER ROARS overhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble moves down train tracks. His jumpsuit is wet with blood from the gash. He pauses and checks the wound. He's going to need stitches. Far down the tracks he sees glow of town lights. He keeps moving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble crosses a tressel, keeps running toward the direction of the lights. A junk yard by railroad tracks and a road. Signs along the road show we're on the edge of town. One says: Hospital-1/2 mile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble runs from a streak up to the railroad tracks. As he nears the junk yard and road he sees the hospital sign. He's close but he can't go into the hospital in his prison jumpsuit. He leans against a wrecked car and catches his breath. Just then a tow truck pulling a car on its hook, turns off the road and parks next to the tracks. Kimble ducks for cover behind the wrecked car. The driver climbs out, dumps his coveralls in the front seat and closes the door. He moves toward a house across the tracks, then forgets something and returns to the cab. He throws open the door and grabs lunch box off the seat - and we notice the coveralls missing from the seat. As the driver returns to the house we MOVE TO the opposite side of the car to find Kimble, ducked beneath the window, clutching the coveralls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A crude headquarters is set up beneath a tent, near the crash site. Maps are laid out on tables. Power and phone lines are pulled down from the lines running along the tracks. Renfro supervises the electronics. Poole handles phones, takes a report from the field and relays it to Gerard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blood trail found. Two miles southwest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Type it and match it against all four prisoners. (to Renfro) Renfro, get an I.D. fax on Kimble to every local hospital. (to Newman) Newman... Newman appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need some coffee. As Newman steps off, everyone turns at sound of SHOUTING from the train crash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shouts up to others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, one's alive!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Loading dock outside the E.R. A WORKER stacks boxes of food outside kitchen entrance. Kimble, in the tow truck operator's coveralls, picks up a box and carries it inside. Once inside he branches off down a hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A door opens on a long hallway. A DOCTOR, CHILD with a bandaged hand, and a MOTHER leave a room and walk TOWARD us. Behind them, Kimble moves down the hall and stops in front of the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble closes the door and locks it. Hanging on the back of the door we see a doctor's white coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An Illinois State Trooper's car pulls up outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On it we see: A packaged sterilized bandage, an opened antiseptic wash, an opened topical anesthetic, and an empty syringe. We PULL BACK to find:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His wound bathed in orange antiseptic wash, three stitches already in. With pair of forceps he picks up the needle as he sutures himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At far end of the hall we see a STATE TROPER chatting with a DUTY NURSE at a nurses' station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble, his bandage already in place, gives himself a shot of antibiotics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man, tube in nose, on two I.V.s, lays in bed with eyes closed. Kimble comes INTO FRAME near his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you hear me, sir? No response. The man is out of it. Kimble backtracks to the patient's closet and opens it. Hanging inside we see his clothes. He removes them and notices the man's untouched breakfast tray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Duty Nurse and State Trooper chat when a fax begins coming through on DESK FAX.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's your fax...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble dressing in the man's clothes. He eats a piece of toast - part of the man's breakfast - as he buttons up his shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His arm slowly reaches out and presses his nurses call button.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A fax photograph of Richard Kimble slowly comes off the duty station FAX MACHINE. Next to the machine the patient's call light comes on. The Duty Nurse, standing with the Highway Trooper, sees the patient's light come on and starts down the hall toward the patient's room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble shaving when we hear the DUTY NURSE ENTER the patient's room. He moves OUT OF FRAME.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Patterson, do you need some more water?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Duty Nurse looks from the tray to the man, impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Oh, you did a good job on this. She takes his empty plastic pitcher and... ... pushes open the bathroom door - no sign of Kimble - and refills the pitcher from the sink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... It does get dry in here, doesn't it? She doesn't expect an answer, turns OFF the WATER, and goes into the main room. As the door closes we see Kimble behind it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble, clean-shaven, and wearing the patient's glasses and a doctor's white coat, moves down the hall to the emergency room exit. Suddenly the State Trooper steps back from the E.R. admissions desk with his newly received fax, and starts down the corridor toward Kimble. The Trooper looks up as the two men pass...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Scuse me, Doc?... Kimble turns but continues slowly backing toward the E.R. doors behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Don't know if you heard or not but we're looking for an escaped prisoner from that bus train wreck 'couple hours ago. Thought he might show up here if he was hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he look like? The Trooper looks down at his fact sheet as we see a slow trickle of blood from a shaving nick begin winding down Kimble's cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Approximately six one, 180 pounds, brown hair, brown eyes and beard. At the last second Kimble feels the drop of blood and wipes it clean as the Trooper looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Seen anyone that fits that description?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every time I look in the mirror ... but without the beard. They laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Kimble moves through the E.R. doors as an ambulance parks outside...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two PARAMEDICS try to take out a patient on a gurney. The lead wheels are stuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here... Kimble helps clear the wheels so the collapsible gurney comes free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Doc, we had to dig him out from under a train. As the gurney comes out, Kimble looks right into the face of the Young Guard. The Guard's eyes suddenly open wide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's him... It's - Kimble claps the portable oxygen mask back over the Young Guard's mouth and keeps his hand there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How is he? The Paramedics move him toward the ramp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's pretty bad off. Broken leg, ribs. Concussion. As Kimble moves away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell the E.R. doctor he's also got a perforated spleen. He's gone... The two Paramedics share a look as they whisk the Young Guard inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, how could he tell that from looking at his face?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble climbs behind the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A full communications link is in place. Deputy marshals answer phones, work faxes, add information to a situation board. Troopers bring in information. Poole calls Gerard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Background just came in from Chicago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hit me. Renfro and Poole lay out the details. The download of information comes clear and fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard David Kimble. Vascular Surgeon. Convicted of first-degree murder in the killing of his wife. Pleaded innocent. Claimed a one-armed -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's not retry the case. Priors and accomplices? Gerard steps up the hillside out of sight of the investigation to take a leak. Followed by Renfro and Poole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None. No previous arrests. Poole takes up a position discreetly behind tree as Gerard unzips his fly and relieves himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sealed juvie record? Poole calls out from behind tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. Total cherry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relatives? Children?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No relatives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One child. A son. Died in drowning accident three years ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Girl friends? Ex-wives? Friends? Combinations of the above?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lot of friends. Doctors. Hospital staff. Gerard zips up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Start there. Authorize taps. Cover his lawyer first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never get it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bet me. Renfro won't take it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have Stevens go to Judge Rubin, he'll sign 'em. ... Biggs charges up the hillside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DeLange Hospital. Wounded guard swears to High Holy he saw Kimble right there in the hallway. Ambulance, missing too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard moves quickly to the map.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me a time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: O-nine-thirty. Twenty minutes ago. Gerard redraws the circle of units. No longer are we covering a fifty-mile radius. The circle is redrawn, tightened, with the hospital as its center. The triangulation is set.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ambulance follows three cars toward a rural railroad crossing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... We're waiting up here in Canton. Wondering if you heard anything on this Kimble chase -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble behind the wheel as he approaches the railroad crossing. The biocom monitors police chatter:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two-twelve-A, be advised that all discussion on this matter is to be conducted on a tactical frequency - either Channel K or Z. Over. Frequency goes dead. Kimble looks THROUGH the windshield:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An arrow points toward Canton, two miles. The cars in front slow as the railroad crossing signal suddenly activates and the bars begin to drop. Kimble pops the SIREN and hurriedly snakes through the crossing and heads in the opposite direction... but his maneuver gets attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Truck driver watches Kimble cut through the crossing and reaches for his C.B. radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poole hangs up phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ambulance just spotted two miles west of Doverville. Heading north on State road 53. Renfro turns to the map and marks it. The circle is much smaller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Running outta map, Sam. The crash site and hospital are already marked. Gerard is ready to move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just the way we want it. Okay, people, let's button up. They move off to waiting State Trooper cars and helicopter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble driving down a rural road. He flips down visor and eyeballs folded roadmap...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... The ambulance crests a hill. In the distance we see the Grosvner Viaduct and the Barkley Dam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blowing other traffic off the road, WHOOPING CRUISERS and G-cars stream south through the rugged rural terrain of Southern Illinois. Overtaking them all, a CHOPPER THUNDERS overhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heading into hilly terrain. Down below we see the ambulance. Inside the helicopter Gerard eyes the terrain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got a visual... (to Gerard) He's heading toward the viaduct.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seal it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AERIAL VIEW OF GROSVNER VIADUCT - DAY The two-lane road disappears into long tunnel. Three hundred feet below the road tumbles the Tennessee River. The Barkley Dam rises ahead. Kimble's AMBULANCE ROARS into the tunnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly sees the helicopter setting down ahead of him at the mouth of the tunnel. Kimble slams on brakes and turns to retreat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Illinois Highway Patrol cars pull to a stop at the far entrance. Light flares. Set out road blocks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: HELICOPTER Gerard steps out followed by Renfro and Poole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Comes to a stop, blocking traffic in both directions. Immediately HORNS begin BLARING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trooper pulls up. Biggs and Newman behind Kimble blocking the other end. Troopers with guns drawn block the exits. The P.A. from a State patrol car blares: P.A. (V.O.) Please remain in your vehicles and lock your doors. Repeat, please remain in -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poole and Renfro materialize already decked out in Kevlar. They're jacked up and ready to rock. Renfro hands Gerard a vest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got him. Gerard unholsters a 40 caliber, Glock model 22.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, ladies and gentlemen hard part's over. He starts into the tunnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're movin' in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weapons drawn, but held discreetly at their sides, three silhouettes enter. Drivers who hadn't heeded the Troopers' P.A. warnings take one look at Gerard and quickly climb back inside and lock their doors. Biggs, Renfro and Poole fan out to the sides and give the middle to Gerard. The tunnel is quickly quiet. Kimble huddles at mid-tunnel. He's trapped. Drops to the ground beneath the truck. His heart pounding, brain clicking, fighting panic. Suddenly he realizes he's in water. Running water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They reach the mid-tunnel area. No Kimble. Biggs looks around, beneath vehicles. Gerard listens. Poole looks confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd he go? Gerard spots the trickle of water. He backtracks it until he finds a loose grate in the pavement. Man-size.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Biggs, Renfro with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble splashes blindly through ankle-deep sluice. He slows at forking tunnels to catch his breath and pick a direction. A DULL ROAR comes from somewhere - from everywhere. He whips off his jacket and slings it down a tunnel, then continues straight ahead. Somewhere behind, lights probe splash-patterns on the conduit wall - telltale signs of Kimble's passing. The lights belong to... Gerard, Biggs and Renfro. They push on, soon reaching the forking tunnels. Renfro finds the jacket ant splash signs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Channel Three. They conform their radios. Splitting up, Biggs and Renfro go left. Gerard - straight ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble. Bracing with all four limbs. Negotiating a mossy downslope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Biggs and Renfro. Sweeping his light as he advances. Searching for splash-patterns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard. Probing a branch-off tunnel with his light. About to pass, he notices scrapings on the mossy walls of the branch-off tunnel. Hand marks?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got a possible here. Stand by. He stows his light but hangs onto the Glock. Bracing with three limbs
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard begins the tricky descent. Slips once. Recovers. Slips again... ... and tumbles out of control. GUN and RADIO CLATTER AWAY. Scrabbling for purchase, he finally snags An overhead pipe. Gerard stabilizes. Sweeps his light to locate his Glock, lying down-tunnel. He eases toward it. But another hand gets there first. It's Kimble. Face dark and desperate. Dangerous. Hand flexing on the pistol. They lock eyes for a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't kill my wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, you didn't kill your wife. Not my problem. An adrenal beat. For a moment they hold a look. Then the silence is broken by Gerard's radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard? You there? Gerard looks for his radio, then back at Kimble - he's gone. Instantly Gerard reaches for his ankle - and pulls a back-up piece.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Renfro hears FOOTSTEPS POUNDING his way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard charges down the tunnel. From a side tunnel, Renfro appears, almost colliding. Biggs follows...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Straight ahead!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble sticks Gerard's gun into his waist band to balance in the tunnel. He spills around a corner and stops. Ahead lies an orb of light. The tunnel ends. The NOISE is incredible. Kimble moves to the end of the tunnel and stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Water pours from the tunnel into the spillway of Barkley dam disappearing into a veil of mist below - a great cauldron of mists. No rocks. None visible at least. He hears the MARSHALS behind him - COMING CLOSER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard and Renfro turn the corner. Renfro drops into a shooting stance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn around, hands over your head. And get down on the ground. For a moment Kimble eyes Gerard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your choice, Kimble... Kimble turns his back on the Marshals, stares again at the water. Slowly he puts his hands over his head. Gerard puts up his gun and pulls his handcuffs. He moves through the water toward Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get down on your knees. Kimble bends slowly, stares down into the falls, hears the footsteps get closer, then does the unthinkable. He jumps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Biggs moving to the top of the massive dam sees Kimble leap into the sheet of water spilling over dam and disappear into the mists below. He can't believe his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renfro lowers his gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son of a bitch... It's the most amazing thing he's ever seen...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stands at the mouth of the tunnel staring down. He stares down into the mists. Impressed. It has told him something invaluable about this fugitive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard scrambles out of the tunnels to the top of the dam near Biggs, just as squad cars, troopers and the search helicopter converge on the site.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Far downriver a figure fights through a snag in the bend. The snag - a tree branch - breaks away and heads down stream. Hanging onto the branch we see Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Below the dam and spillway. Troopers in waders search the shallows, deputies beat bushes along the shore. Farther out we see a dredge boat slowly working the waters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard watches the dredge cage come up again. As if with the next pass it will prove him the victor. The HEAD ILLINOIS TROOPER CAPTAIN approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Running out of daylight, Inspector.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lights and generators are coming, Captain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I don't mean to tell you your job, but maybe one person in a million could've survived that fall. The guy's fish food. Gerard turns and brings his look to bear on the Captain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then find me the fish that ate him. He turns and heads to a waiting helicopter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble runs through the woods. He staggers, his arm hooks a sapling which spins him to the ground. He lays motionless, exhausted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. KIMBLE'S HOUSE - DAY ANGLE Helen in bed. Kimble's hand comes INTO FRAME and touches her shoulder. She turns toward Kimble as he moves INTO FRAME and kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen tosses her head back. She wears white silk pajamas and smiles down AT us. A hand reaches up and unbuttons the top two buttons of her top. Then Kimble moves up INTO FRAME as we -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen running down beach TOWARD us. Embraces Kimble as we -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen's head comes up out of a pool. Hair tossed back, she smiles as we -

direction.raw_text: Helen exiting Kimble's car the night of the murder. She looks back at Kimble, framed by the door frame, ant smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good-bye. I love you. Again... Then again... then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble comes out of his sleep with a start. Shivering. He remembers where he is. His breathing returns to normal.

direction.raw_text: Kimble moves across a river trestle and disappears into tunnel.

He takes a box of black hair dye off the shelf and looks at the instructions. When he looks up he sees the pharmacist looking at him.

direction.raw_text: A roadside diner. Kimble, his hair now black, and wearing a new pair of Wranglers, hooded sweatshirt and a duffle coat, moves down the road to the diner.

direction.raw_text: Kimble enters. He sits at the counter and a sparky OLDER WAITRESS, late, mid-forties, with strong good looks and tough smile fills his coffee cup before he even asks.

direction.raw_text: Need to look at the menu?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some soup, please.

direction.raw_text: Good choice. She marks her pad and leaves. Sights ant sounds around Kimble begins to occupy his attention: A dishwasher buses a tub of dishes back to the kitchen. He stares at him. A farmer sitting at a table stares at Kimble, Kimble looks away. A man at the pay phone seems to be staring at him. Is he calling the police? Everyone seems to be looking at him. Someone stops in front of him. A young waitress serves him his soup. Where's the first waitress? Takes a few sips of soup. Out of the corner of his eye he sees: The Older Waitress putting on her coat to leave. Is she going to report him? He fights the paranoia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the TELEVISION gets his attention.

direction.raw_text: A report on the escape. A television reporter describes the chase for Kimble; his jump at the dam and his presumed death from the fall. Kimble decides it's time to leave. He drops some money on the counter and exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble moves across the parking lot trying not to run until he's out of sight of the diner. Once free of the lights of the diner he starts running and disappears into the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble running down the road. Fields stretch out on both sides of the highway. Open land. From behind him we suddenly hear the sound of POLICE SIRENS. For a moment Kimble moves faster, then as the SIRENS COME CLOSER, his sprint drops to a jog... to a walk, until finally he stops and waits for the inevitable... But the flashing lights suddenly rip past him chasing a speeder. They weren't after him after all. Kimble looks at himself. He's shaking. A moment later he is lit by headlights. A car pulls up next to him, passenger window rolls down...

direction.raw_text: Need a ride? Kimble stares at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which way are you going? She smiles and points in the direction her car is traveling. They hold a look as we hear:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We feel confident about the I.D.

Just early morning traffic. We see Renfro and Newman watch the house from across the street, behind a deserted house. Gerard joins them. We see that Biggs is in the plumbing truck. Poole is the homeless woman picking through the garbage. Newman hands Gerard a radio.

direction.raw_text: Local officials were about to wet their pants to move in.

Running out of house. He braces himself swings into the kitchen - it too is empty. Suddenly Gerard gets the bad feeling he's passed his prey.

direction.raw_text: Surges out, knocks Newman's gun from his hand. In a flash, Copeland yanks Newman's arm behind his back and presses a knife against the deputy's neck and moves him out of the room. We...

direction.raw_text: Keeps moving down the hallway, through first bedroom, pauses at door to the second bedroom and chooses his course.

direction.raw_text: Copeland positions himself between the bedroom door and the hallway opening. He's troubled he can't hear Gerard. Suddenly he hears a NOISE behind him at the bedroom door He whips Newman around and we see: A shoe hits the floor. Copeland realizes his mistake too late. He turns back to the hallway and there is Gerard. He never blinks. FIRES once killing Copeland instantly. The knife falls to the floor. Newman clutches his head, stunned but unhurt. Gerard now turns to the screaming woman behind him in the bedroom doorway.

direction.raw_text: Shut up. She does. Immediately.

direction.raw_text: As coroners and tactical police mop up. Gerard moves across the yard, sips coffee from Styrofoam cup. He stops at a sheriff's car, Newman sits on back seat, shaken, nearly hysterical, clutching his ear.

direction.raw_text: My ear... I can't hear a thing out of it. I can't believe you did that!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I should have bargained with him, don't you?

direction.raw_text: Yes. You could've missed! You could've killed me!

direction.raw_text: Yeah, you're absolutely right. I could've. They hold a look.

direction.raw_text: How bad's your ear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terrible. I probably have permanent hearing damage.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't bargain. Gerard leaves. Newman watches him - realizing what a truly unsettling man Gerard is.

direction.raw_text: Walter. It's Richard.

direction.raw_text: Richard... Jesus, why did you run? Running only makes you look guilty.

direction.raw_text: I wasn't worrying about appearances, Walter.

direction.raw_text: Tell me where you are. I'll come meet you so you can turn yourself in .

direction.raw_text: I'm not turning myself in. I need money. Gutherie is silent. When he speaks again his speech takes on the lawyerly tone of a man who's covering his own bases.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard. You're asking me to harbor and aid a convicted felon... I can't help you that way. My advice - both as a friend and as your legal counsel - is for you to give yourself up. Now tell me... where are you? Kimble picks up the change in his attorney's tone.

direction.raw_text: St. Louis.

direction.raw_text: Give me an address. I'll be -

direction.raw_text: See you tomorrow, Dr. Nichols?

direction.raw_text: Creature of habit, Sharon.

direction.raw_text: As he pulls up to the first stoplight, a homeless man moves toward the driver's side and begins washing his windshield. Nichols waves the man off.

direction.raw_text: Not today, please. The man shuffles off. Just then a second man appears at his passenger window. He leans down to wave him away
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Not - ... then stops - the face at his passenger window is Richard Kimble's.

direction.raw_text: Oh, my God... Richard... Nichols rolls down the passenger window.

direction.raw_text: You're alive...

direction.raw_text: Anything.

direction.raw_text: Tell me where you're staying. I'll get you more money. Some clothes. Just give me an address...

direction.raw_text: I'll call you. Kimble glances around, the area is still clear. He looks back into the car and doesn't see the police car turn the corner and come up the street behind them. Nichols finds his wallet ant hands all the cash he's got to Kimble, who quickly pockets it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know why you came back - to find him. If I can help, call me... Call me. They hold a look. The stoplight changes to green but they don't see it.

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Charlie...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, Richard, take my coat... He reaches into the back for his coat, suddenly police car behind him POPS its SIREN. Nichols looks into his rearview mirror. Sees a COP lean out his window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, buddy - green light. Let's go. Nichols looks back at Kimble. He's gone.

direction.raw_text: Kimble also at work at the bedside table. He carefully cuts out his do-it-yourself photograph and places it over the existing photograph on the hospital I.D. The name on the I.D. says: Desmondo Jose Ruiz. Then he places a thin piece of lamination plastic and trims the edges. Kimble defaces the plastic to give it rough look, then examines the finished product not bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) If this guy existed believe me someone would've found him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He raises an eyebrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NICHOLS' OFFICE - CLOSE ON FRAMED PHOTOGRAPH - DAY Of medical residents. Two photographs next to each other. A young Richard Kimble and Charles Nichols.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard Kimble... I saw him two days ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to see: Gerard studying the photos. Renfro looks up like someone's bitten him. He, Biggs and Gerard are in Nichols' administrative office. Gleaming. Filled with awards and photos of Nichols and influential people. Nichols hangs up his lab coat and slips back into his suitcoat. He shows no sign of nervousness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stopped me in my car. I gave him some money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where was this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Outside our tennis - (correcting himself) - my tennis club. Gerard moves around Nichols' office taking in the details.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did he ask you for help?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I volunteered. He wouldn't accept it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you think he came back to Chicago?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He didn't tell me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't ask you that, sir. I'm sure he was trying to protect you from having to lie for him. Gerard continues to move around the room, study prints, books, drawings, awards and photos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're really his friend, you'll help us bring him in unharmed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, so he can go back to prison? If you want help, gentlemen, you've come to the wrong man. Gerard finds a photo of Nichols and a gleaming Ferrari.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Nichols, last year the U.S. Marshals' office closed out 11,003 warrants... 10,975 of those were captured. The twenty-eight others thought they were smarter than us... Now they're dead. (re: the photo) Nice car. Gerard puts the photo down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard and his deputies leave Nichols' outer office. Gerard clearly feels he's come to the right man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble mopping the trauma room hallway. The hallway elbows around a corner and Kimble stands less than ten feet from a door that is marked: "PROSTHETIC CLINIC" He watches a technician leave the clinic and mops closer to the doorway, and fails to see an attractive WOMAN DOCTOR with white coat and stethoscope draped around her neck turn the corner behind him ant step on the freshly mopped section. Head down, she is completely absorbed in a file and doesn't see the wet floor until she slips slightly, looks up but keeps walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Rudy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They said he's sick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't they tell you to put up the sign?
direction.name: direction
