direction.raw_text: Uhhh. No they didn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put up the 'wet floor' sign before someone gets hurt. She keeps going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Asshole. She looks back at Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. Anne keeps moving off toward trauma hall. He watches her turn the corner to the trauma hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble enters the dimly lit prosthetics lab. He moves silently among the casts and prosthetics of arms, hands, legs hanging from the ceiling. Cables and electronic equipment are on the counters. He leaves the lab and moves into the office section of the Prosthetic Clinic. He passes a computer room and finally reaches the office. He is about to enter when a woman's voice stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Ricky... Weren't you just in here? Kimble turns to see a PROSTHETIC TECHNICIAN. A large woman with glasses. She stands with a partially finished prosthetic arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. KIMBLE'S OLD HOUSE - NIGHT The one-armed man's arm coming off in the fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, I thought you were Ricky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... I've got to clean the blinds in the office. Want me to wait till you're finished?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw... I'm going to be here all night. You won't bother me. She slips on a pair of headphones and goes back to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble cleaning the blinds, keeps an eye on the Technician who is listening to music on her Walkman. She is carefully painting a section of the arm. Not watching Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Opened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nimble looks over his shoulder. The Technician doesn't see him. A Prosthetic Clinic Operations Manual is removed from shelf. Photographs of prosthetic arms. Kimble shifts the materials into his clothes, closes his coat and suddenly he stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble waits for the elevator. The folders in his uniform shift and he tries to rearrange them. When he turns back we see Anne Eastman beside him. Her I.D. says: "ANNE EASTMAN". She sees him doing the rearranging. The elevator arrives. They step into:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anne moves to the back. Kimble on the other side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, how're you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You find that sign?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You called me an asshole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me. I was having a bad shift. They laugh. They reach ground level and step out together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You worked at other hospitals?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lots of them over the years. Here, long ago. Hasn't changed much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet it hasn't. See you. They part ways. Kimble continues out the door. Anne stops and watches him leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble sits on the night train going home. He begins looking at his information.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Afternoon light comes in Kimble's basement windows. Sheets of Prosthetic Clinic patient material are spread over Kimble's bed, floor. Kimble searches through the documents, making notes. He studies photos of attachments. Cable attachments. Joints. Electronics. Pins. straps... looking for a key to the identity of the one-armed man. Finally he stops. He finds the flyer in his pocket, puts it on the bedside table and moves to sink. He wets a towel and covers his face. Draws a cool damp breath. Lays back on bed amid the Prosthetic Clinic material.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - FIGHT Kimble pulls the arm. It separates in the one-armed man's sleeve. Wrenches. Dis-articulates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - ONE-ARMED MAN Reacts in pain. Again. (NOTE: We sense Kimble's mind returning to something. Getting closer to the key...)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - ONE-ARMED MAN Escaping the bedroom. We hear his FOOTSTEPS DOWN the STAIRS... a DOOR SLAM. FOOTSTEPS again. Another DOOR SLAMS, but this time the sound is distinctly different... a CAR DOOR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble yanks the wet rag from his face, his senses alert. Listening, he hears: FOOTSTEPS are real, just outside and MOVING TOWARD him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A car door slams. We see unmarked police cars pulling up in front of the apartment. Cops are moving toward the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble turns off his light, moves from the bed to the window. Carefully looks out:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unmarked police cars in front of the house, looking, moving his way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble moves instinctively to the back door. He starts to open it but through the dirty window, he sees the back courtyard covered by more cops. Kimble moves back toward the front. Unsure of his next move, he's sweating, preparing for the worst. He watches the TAC team charge the house but instead of charging through the basement door they move up the front steps and into the house overhead. Overhead he hears the SCREAMING from the arresting cops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble SEES the Punk Kid try to escape out the back. He runs, sees cops and runs toward Kimble's basement door, actually reaching it before he is caught by the cops and pulled away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moves toward the front window and watches cops lead the Punk Kid out to the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: call the other cops to stand down. Kimble moves slowly to his front door. Looks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cops put the young man into an unmarked police car. His grandmother, the Polish woman, follows them, crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble leans against the wall, exhausted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble carries his cleaning tray down busy hallway just outside of the Prosthetic Clinic and stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two cops talk outside the Prosthetic Clinic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble backs to a safe place in the trauma hallway to wait for them to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Punk Kid is handcuffed to a bench as a cop works on a report. Suddenly the Kid notices something that gets his attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A wanted poster of Kimble over the cop's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Kid sees - Wanted for Murder - realizes who it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Hey! I know that guy! The cop looks up, sees Kimble's poster and then back at the Kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble moves toward prosthetic clinic. In passing through the trauma hallway he becomes aware of a crisis developing. A major accident has happened, victims are being brought in. The P.A. CALLS for doctors. STATIC.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elevator doors open as orderlies bring in new patients. Some walk, some are helped by family and police. Nurses direct traffic. Orders fly. Medicines are called. Family members yell for doctors. Ask for the injured. Anne picks up the pace with an ORDERLY wheeling a gurney carrying a young patient, a BOY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bus flipped off the overpass. Got at least twenty more coming in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about this one here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fractured sternum. X-ray's coming up. Anne checks the boy's chart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, we've got to get some room in this hallway, people. Orderlies quickly move the non-life-threatening patients out of the hall. Still more help is needed. Anne spots Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, take this one up the hall to Critical Care. Kimble nods. Anne moves to another patient. Kimble grabs the kid's gurney and begins wheeling it up the hall. As he pushes he looks at the kid's X-rays. Anne looks up, barks another order, then suddenly sees Kimble pushing the gurney and looking at the film.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tries to negotiate through the incoming patients to get a better look, but Kimble is gone. She goes back to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wheels the Boy's gurney into an elevator. The doors close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .R. CORRIDOR - NIGHT Kimble wheels the gurney down the hall and stops the Boy on the scrub threshold to the O.R. and stops a SURGEON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Hey! A Surgeon pauses and eyes Kimble's janitor suit and the gurney.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They just sent this one up. He takes a look at the Boy's chart and grabs the X-rays and yells to O.R. nurse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob! Get this one into room four, stat. He looks up, Kimble is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble enters the Prosthetic Clinic computer room. The Technician from the day before is listening to her Walkman, sees Kimble and waves. Kimble waves back and turns into the glass-walled computer room and closes the door. He closes the blinds and turns on the computer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crisis has wound down. Anne moves into the room and begins checking patients. She stops a unit nurse, GLADYS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gladys, where's the boy I sent down with the janitor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What boy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one with the fractured sternum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He never came in here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble scans DOS files, each an eight-letter enigma. Finds one with promise and loads it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wrong... He backs up and tries another file.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AGE, SEX, RACE, LIMB, OR OTHER

direction.raw_text: : AGE, SEX, RACE, LIMB, OR OTHER?" Kimble knows he's got it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble keys in these responses:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MALE" AGE: 35-50 RACE: CAUCASIAN LIMB: RIGHT ARM OTHER: POINT OF REPLACEMENT: MID HUMERUS" INT. OPERATING ROOM WING - NIGHT Anne comes out of the stairwell and stops the Surgeon we saw with Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dave, did you see a janitor come up here earlier?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, he brought a kid up. (handing her the chart) Anne, did you write the orders? I couldn't make out the signature...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoever did knew what the hell he was doing. Kid's a hair away from a ruptured aorta. He heads to the operating room, leaving her stunned. She stares at the scrawled orders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT A "PLEASE WAIT" message appears on the screen. We hear the COMPUTER PROCESSING, searching, narrowing. The screen flashes:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 75 DO YOU WISH TO SUBDIVIDE?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seventy-five. Hell, yes. Kimble types in another defining characteristic... Residence: Illinois. Again he waits. Rattles the blinds to make it seem like he's cleaning. The list shortens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 21" KIMBLE What else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. CHICAGO COURTROOM - DAY Prosecutor stands before the jury.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... murdering Helen Wills Kimble the night of January 20...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble types in: "Candidates having adjustment appointments between January 21, and February 1, 1993." Kimble waits. Sixty-five names come up. Again too many. Kimble's reached a dead end. Kimble thinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. KIMBLE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT The fight with the One-Armed Man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something has clicked in his memory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble stands beneath the hanging artificial limbs. He takes down an arm, works the joint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. KIMBLE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT Kimble fights the One-Armed Man. He wrenches the man's prosthetic arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ON ARM He moves it again. Harder, at an awkward angle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. KIMBLE'S BEDROOM - TIGHTER ON ONE-ARMED MAN'S ARM - NIGHT Kimble wrenches the arm...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The joint strains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. KIMBLE'S BEDROOM - CLOSE ON ONE-ARMED MAN'S ARM Kimble wrenches it and it BREAKS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A detailed diagram of arm construction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble makes notes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anne rides the elevator back to trauma. She's thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joint repair list between January 21-April 21... Five names come up with Greater Chicago addresses. Kimble hits print. The MACHINE begins PRINTING. Kimble looks up at the Prosthetic Clinic Technician - she is listening to her headphones, can't hear the printer. He continues to shake the blinds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble leaves Prosthetic Clinic and starts down the hall for the exit when a voice stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have a particular interest in our patients' x-rays? Kimble turns to see Anne coming toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw you looking at that boy's chest film. She moves in on him. He eyes the exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a hobby of mine -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What other hobbies do you have? Brain surgery?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want? She reaches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to know how that kid ended up in surgery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a janitor. I did what I was told.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit. Who changed those orders? They hold a look. She knows. He takes a step back and she pulls his I.D.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You stand right here. I'm calling security. Kimble runs. Anne turns to call security but doesn't. She stares after Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble's room being searched by the marshals. Gerard finds the flyer Kimble was handed on his way out the door. On it we see: COOK COUNTY HOSPITAL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .D. - DAY Anne and Gerard stand in the hallway. Gerard studies the I.D.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man posing as a janitor orders an emergency operation and all you do is pull his I.D.?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little boy's alive today because he did something. Gerard watches her eyes carefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, you weren't aware that when he escaped he was being transported to Menard State Prison to begin a term of life imprisonment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For murdering his wife. Clearly this is news to Anne. Gerard almost smiles at her surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you for your help, Doctor. He moves to the position Anne saw Kimble with the kid's gurney. Trying to imagine what Kimble was doing at that place. Renfro and the other deputies converge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I can't figure is, if you were Kimble, why'd you take a major league chance of hanging around a trauma ward? Gerard considers this as a Man passes him. Gerard notices something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The place would be crawling with cops. Slowly Gerard separates from the group of deputies and follows the Man down the hall. The Man Gerard is following turns the corner to the Prosthetic hallway and realizing Gerard is following him, holds the hallway door open for Gerard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I help you find something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, sir, I think you already have. We see the Man has a prosthetic arm and that they are outside the door marked: "PROSTHETIC CLINIC" INT. PHONE BOOTH - MORNING Restaurant deserted at this hour. Kimble makes calls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... This is Dr. Elway at Cook County. I'm doing follow-up work for the Prosthetic Clinic on Matthew Zelick... (beat) He did... I'm terribly sorry. No, I'll correct our files. Thank you. He scratches through another name. Three left. He dials another number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard and his deputies inside the Prosthetic Clinic. Artificial limbs are being tested, fitted. A technician fits a demonstration model on Biggs while Gerard and Poole work with the director of the institute and a data operator at the computer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The onearmed man. Missing the right or left hand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. The operator enters that information. Dropping the number to 250... as Poole continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble on phone. He hangs up and scratches through another name. Two left. He dials another number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poole looks up from her file to the computer screen. The number drops to 117...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Location of the attachment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mid-humerus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The next name is "Clive Driscoll." Kimble on phone, waits for answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello... looking for your brother, Clive. This is Ted Riley with the high school reunion committee. Believe it or not, 25 years is just around the corner, and Clive's on our list of lost souls. Information gave me a number, but when I tried it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R to reveal Kimble on the pay phone. The scrap of paper is his list-of-five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No kidding?... Armed robbery. (forced laughter) He's where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard looks at the screen. The number drops to 20.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It could take us a week to track down every one of those names. Gerard picks up phone and dials a number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stevens... I've got a list of names I want searched for criminal history.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble stands on a sidewalk, staring at the imposing edifice across the street. After a here-we-go breath, he starts through traffic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble waits for an elevator. It opens to reveal a pack of staring COPS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Comin' or not? Forcing his feet to move, Kimble boards...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and pivots quickly. Elevator rises. Floor-indicator moves deathly slow. Kimble feels the breath of a dozen COPS on his neck. And just when his floor is mercifully about to arrive... Overhead lights flicker, and the elevator jars to a stop between floors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, shit... Not now... Anybody bring a deck of cards? Abruptly they're moving again. Kimble's heart restarts with the elevator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to visitor) Booth Three. No hands on the glass. Five minutes maximum. Be advised that under a Federal court ruling your conversation can be recorded. Next. "Next" is Kimble. He steps to the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Name of inmate?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clive Driscoll. The Clearing Officer spins his clipboard around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sign here, print your name, address, and relationship to inmate below. (into mike) Two-zero-ten. Driscoll, Clive R. (to Kimble) Be about five minutes. You can wait in the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard and Biggs cross the lobby and stop in front of the desk; flash their U.S. Marshal's ID.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to see a prisoner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifth floor. Gerard and Biggs head for the bank of elevators.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's hinky. Man risks everything to find a man his own investigators say doesn't exist. Something's really hinky about this thing. Gerard looks at Biggs as they reach the elevators.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate that word. He hits the up button.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clearing Officer looks down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Visitor for Driscoll...? Kimble is on his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Booth seven. No hands on the glass. Be advised... The Clearing Officer, head down, drones on - doesn't notice Kimble is already gone. Kimble strides down the row of chairs, rounds the last partition to reach booth seven - and to stare at the one-armed man, DRISCOLL, who waits there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So who are you?
direction.name: direction

result.heading: FACE OF HELEN'S KILLER CUT TO

direction.raw_text: - FACE OF HELEN'S KILLER CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Driscoll's face is different. Driscoll is a black man. KIMBLE Sorry. I made a mistake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit, that's okay. Stick around a few minutes, talk about whatever you want... But Kimble is gone. Driscoll calls after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... They're not exactly wired for cable downstairs, y'know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble exits the visitor's area. He sees another crowd of COPS around the elevator again, opts for the door marked: "STAIRS" INT. FEDERAL LOCKUP - LOBBY - DAY Biggs and Gerard wait for the elevator. Finally Gerard's had enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where're the damn stairs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's five flights!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then you wait. He finds the door and starts up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble descending. Doors open and close throughout the stairwell but the traffic is light...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Climbing the stairs. He reaches a landing - and skims shoulders with Kimble, who pivots past on his way down. Amazingly, neither man reacts. Not yet. One flight above, Gerard's subconscious taps him on the shoulder and brings him to a dead stop. He leans over the stairwell railing to spy... Kimble spiraling downward. From this vantage, it could be any dark-haired man. But still...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a quick probe) Kimble. Others look up out of curiosity... but not Kimble. Two landings below, he falters a step, then tries to regain his step, keeps moving. But Gerard is pulling his Glock: The hitch in Kimble's stride told him everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble! Kimble blitzes down the stairs. Gerard moves after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble throws open a fire door and starts across the lobby. Sees two cops, quickly approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Officers - there's a man in the stairwell waving a gun and screaming. The two cops rush to stairs and Kimble immediately moves toward the doors, fast but not running. Hoping to cloak himself in civilians.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Biggs' elevator has finally arrived and emptied. He lets a woman on in front of him, oblivious to... Kimble moving... The revolving exit doors loom nearer ant nearer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two cops see Gerard. Gerard holds up his badge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .S. Marshal! Get on the phone, call your commander, tell him there's a top-fifteen warrant in the building. Go. He shoves the cops out of the way and pounds downstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble closing in on the door when suddenly a KLAXON HORN sounds. People stop in confusion. Automatically, the exit doors begin closing. Biggs pushes his way off the elevator. Kimble breaks into a sprint for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bursts out the stairwell door after Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble. Stop! But there's only one way of stopping Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enters the revolving doors as a big man enters from the outside. The big man sizes up the situation, realizes Kimble is fleeing and just before Kimble exits - yanks on the door - trapping him partially inside the revolving door. Other doors seal electronically. Biggs charges back, sees Gerard. Kimble fights the heavy glass door. The big man resists - but slowly the crack widens. Gerard bulls through the crowd, shoves a man out of his line of fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Down. down. everybody down! With adrenal effort, Kimble wrings his body through the opening...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and makes it outside - except for his foot - caught like in a bear trap, as the door locks down. Harrowed, Kimble looks back over his shoulder at... Gerard. Charging the glass doors. Civilians suck marble and clear out of Gerard's line of fire on Kimble. Gerard takes aim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble. Stop! It's Kimble's nightmare coming true. If he could chew off his leg right now, he would. He pulls at his foot just as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard FIRES seven times in two seconds. Kimble goes down. SHOTS and SCREAMS ECHO around the lobby. A long beat, then Gerard rises. THROUGH GLASS studded with bullet holes, he sees... Kimble rising... staring back. Equally astounded that he's alive. He runs free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open the doors! Gerard pounds against the doors. Sees cratering in the glass - and then sees flattened slugs all over the floor. It's bullet-proof glass. THROUGH the glass he sees Kimble rush across the street and disappear into the parade. Doors open and Gerard and his men follow. But Kimble has disappeared into the parade celebrations outside. Blending in with the marchers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble leaves a cheap hotel early the next morning. He wears a new set of clothes - jeans, sport coat and tie - than the day before, and the black hair coloring has been rinsed from his hair. He moves down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble uses a pay phone and stares through the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Across the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inside the apartment the PHONE RINGS. No one is home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The PHONE RINGS nine, ten times. As Kimble waits he looks down at his list of five. The only name remaining is Fredrick Sykes. He looks down the street - it seems clear - then his focus shifts to a man carrying two coffees. He approaches a car parked along the curb. The passenger - a woman - leans across the seat and opens the door for him. He hands her a cup of coffee and as he starts to climb in, he shifts something on his hip - we see the butt of a handgun. Kimble hangs up and leaves through the back door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble moves across the roof and drops to fire escape behind Sykes' apartment. He looks in the window, steps back to see if anyone is looking, then pulls his fist back into his sleeve and with one swift pop, BREAKS the GLASS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No sound. Slowly he moves into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moving first toward the living room. The apartment is modest. He stops by a photograph of a teenage girl. Another is a boy in football uniform. The next one is a man in a police uniform. Kimble freezes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. KIMBLE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT OF MURDER Kimble struggles with the one-armed man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble struggles to recall the man's face. It could be him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble searching for clues to Sykes' identity. He opens closets, wardrobe, bureau... reopens a drawer. There, in the bottom he finds an old prosthetic arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble looking through Sykes' desk drawers finds a package of photographs. He opens them and quickly flips through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A group of men on a business/vacation junket stand around a large sportfish hung from the dock. Kimble keeps flipping through, suddenly stops and backs up and we see what stopped him: The smiling face of Dr. Alexander Lentz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. HOTEL BALLROOM - NIGHT OF MURDER Nichols introduces Kimble to Lentz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard... Alex Lentz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are three photos of Lentz. Kimble slowly pulls one out of the pack. As he slides it out we see a fish and on the other side we see... Sykes, wearing a prosthetic arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. KIMBLE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT OF MURDER Kimble struggles with intruder. This time we see his face clearly. It is Sykes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble flips back to the earlier group photos and we see a Devlin-MacGregor banner over the group shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks up. He's found the man he's looking for but also a new possibility - that the murder wasn't just a random act of violence. Kimble digs through Sykes' top desk drawer. His mind reeling. He stops:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Devlin-MacGregor Pharmaceutical logo in the top right corner. Payroll level four: Security.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .S. MARSHAL'S OFFICE - MORNING PHONE RINGS. SECRETARY answers it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .S. Marshal's office... Her expression changes to shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard is moving down the hall with a cup of coffee when the Secretary appears at a door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It' 9 Kimble on line three. Gerard moves quickly down the hall, mobilizing his troops as he runs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renfro, Biggs... They follow him into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard moves to phone as TECHNICIAN gives him nod he's ready. Gerard answers the phone and the trace begins. Renfro supervises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Gerard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you remember what I told you in the tunnel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You told me, you didn't kill your wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MORNING KIMBLE Remember what you said to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard is calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember you were pointing my gun at me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said, 'I don't care.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The numbers rush down. Technician reads the first set to Renfro.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's on the southside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right, Kimble... I'm not trying to solve a puzzle here. I'm just the poor working man that's paid to hunt you down. The room is filling up with deputies. Poole, Biggs, Stevens, Newman. Gerard watches the numbers as the second digit locks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's in Pullman area... Fifteen seconds for location.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MORNING KIMBLE Well, I am trying to solve the puzzle, Gerard and I just found a piece. Kimble takes the phone and bangs it down onto a table and we realize he is in Sykes' kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sound startles Gerard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three seconds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Kimble? Kimble leaves the phone on the table and walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone) You can't control this thing, Kimble... Kimble? He thinks he hears FOOTSTEPS over the phone, realizes Kimble has not hung up. What's Kimble doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is he? Renfro looks up from the address to Gerard, stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy shit. We've got a car there right now. He picks up a phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two cops receive a radio report about Kimble and quickly exit their car. They rush toward Sykes' building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: While they move into the apartment, we see Kimble, fully aware of them, slip away down the alley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Sykes. Lentz. Devlin-MacGregor. R.D.U.90. Lines draw connections.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. OPERATING ROOM - NIGHT OF MURDER Kimble and Chief Resident work feverishly to save patient.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This an R.D.U.90 patient? Kimble looks up at the Resident as we...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It BUZZES off the hook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Name is Fredrick Sykes. 45. Ex cop . A hand comes INTO FRAME ant replaces the receiver on the cradle. We WIDEN to find: Gerard. We see technicians dusting room for prints. A FORENSIC TECH approaches Gerard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inspector, we're ready for you to look at this. The Forensic Tech sits at desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble's prints are all over the apartment, but the concentration is here. The Tech takes out the check stubs, some papers; the pack of photos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Tech flips through the pack, stops on the Lentz/Sykes photos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He flips through the pack but paused here. He hands the Lentz/Sykes photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me see the negatives. The Tech hands him the strip of negative film. Gerard holds it up to the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One's missing. Gerard stares at the photo as his RADIO SQUAWKS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here he comes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fredrick Sykes, the one-armed man, comes down the side walk. He passes a car and hears the door open behind him. Biggs climbs out of the car and falls into step behind him. Sykes hears the footsteps but moves on up the stoop and starts to enter his apartment, notices the front door already open. Cops and Marshals in his house. Processing a crime scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell's going on here? Who are you people? He steps...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... sees Gerard in the kitchen. Gerard stares at Sykes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You had a break-in, Mr. Sykes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You a cop?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is Gerard. U.S. Marshal's Office. Sykes is caught off guard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This morning a fugitive named Richard Kimble made a call from your apartment. Sykes is dumbfounded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard Kimble... I don't know a Richard Kim - Poole produces a photo of Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute... This is the doctor who killed his wife... He claimed the killer had a prosthetic limb. You telling me he's coming after me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would he have a reason to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell's that supposed to mean? Because I have this? He lifts his prosthetic arm and stares at Gerard. Gerard holds his look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, a year ago some people came to see me. They asked me questions about the night of the murder and I'll tell you the same thing I told them. I wasn't even in town then. I was on a business trip. Gerard continues moving around the apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of business are you in, Mr. Sykes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Security.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Independent?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I work for a pharmaceutical company. I handle security for its top executives. Gerard holds up one of the fishing photographs with Lentz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any idea why Kimble would be interested in these?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Just some doctors on a company junket. Gerard puts the photos down with the one of Lentz on top. Sykes eyes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, you mind if I talk to the cops to see if anything's missing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By all means. Sykes moves off and Gerard pockets the Lentz/Sykes photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard crosses the street with Renfro and Biggs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's pulling our chain, Sam. If this was the guy Kimble was looking for, why call us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble said he's putting together a puzzle. We don't need to put it together too, we just need to be there when he gets to the next piece. Gerard stops and looks back at Sykes' apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep somebody on him. If he moves I want to know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble moves through large medical library and turns into area marked: PHARMACOLOGY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pages turn as we get CLOSER on headings: "DRUGS PENDING FDA APPROVAL..." Experimental and commercial names MOVE PAST us... and at the end of the list we find: "PROVASIC (RDU90) Developed by Devlin-MacGregor Pharmaceuticals".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BUSINESS PHARMACEUTICAL JOURNAL Kimble opens to article entitled: "DEVLIN-MACGREGOR EXPECTS PAYDIRT WITH PROVASIC." "Pharmaceutical company plans to go public on introduction of new drug, Provasic (R.D.U.90)." Kimble looks up. Now he knows why someone tried to kill him. He gathers more Devlin-Macgregor information including a prospectus, and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An OPERATOR answers a call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry sir, Dr. Nichols is at a medical conference at the Hilton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's very important I reach him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A meeting is underway around a board room table. An ASSISTANT moves around the table and gives Nichols a message with a number and "URGENT" written on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, sir, they said it was an emergency. Nichols excuses himself from the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble answers a pay PHONE when it RINGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you talk?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nichols on phone at the other end of the suite. The meeting continues behind him. As soon as he hears Kimble's voice, Nichols reacts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard. Yes... I'm on a hotel phone. What's going on? He eyes the group in the other room, moves around the corner for more privacy. As he does we notice several of the men watching. They exchange glances.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I found him, Charlie. I found the guy that killed Helen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all about a drug, Charlie. They tried to kill me because of a drug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Devlin-MacGregor and Lentz. Lentz was supervising the R.D.U.90 protocol. He knew I'd found out the drug had problems. It's Lentz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard, Lentz is dead. He died in an auto accident last summer. Kimble is stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you prove this about the drug?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need your help. Call Mr. Roosevelt and tell him I'm coming in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The group of deputies and Gerard assemble around Gerard's information board. They've come armed with facts and theories. Gerard orchestrates the information.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you were Richard Kimble... Why would you hunt for a one-armed man you think killed your wife; find hint then leave him and call us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To throw us off his trail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unless... What if you were a well respected surgeon and wanted to kill your wife? How would you do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd hire a pro. Sight unseen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Set it up to look like a robbery gone bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How would you find him? Look in the phone book?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through a connection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe through a company you did some business with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like a pharmaceutical company. Someone in security.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the night of his wife's murder, Kimble attended a hospital benefit sponsored by Devlin-Macgregor Pharmaceutical - Sykes' company. Gerard places a Devlin-Macgregor card onto his board.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Sykes claims he was out of town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And company records support that he was on a business trip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's an easy fix. So let's say he was in town. Did the job. Everything goes as planned with one problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Instead of looking like a robbery gone bad, Kimble ends up being the one accused...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... tried, convicted...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and the hit man gets away clean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So Kimble returns to hunt for and find the hit man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? To share the blame? He'd still go to prison. Gerard moves to the board. He takes down a card.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're underestimating the power of the good doctor. It would be his word against... Sykes'. Who would you believe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what does Kimble do next?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get help. Gerard pins the card to the board and looks at Renfro. It says: "NICHOLS" GERARD Stevens, check phone records for Sykes and Kimble. Gerard moves to the door and Renfro follows. As he's leaving he hands the photo of Lentz and Sykes to Biggs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Find out who this guy is. He leaves. Biggs hands the photo to Newman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do I get all the great jobs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble enters the hospital through the loading dock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROOSEVELT, an ancient research assistant, opens the door to Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It sure is good to see you again, Dr. Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You too, Roosevelt... Been a long time. Roosevelt closes the door behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roosevelt brings Kimble a file marked: "R.D.U.90"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the R.D.U.90 file and samples. Dr. Nichols said you needed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Roosevelt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A cop stares up at Sykes' house from across the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sykes watches the cops in the car outside. He moves to the phone and dials number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emergency operator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to report a fire; No, it's not my place, it's a couple doors down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WAHLUND'S LAB - DAY Kimble moves down hall and quietly enters a small research lab in the university. Dr. Wahlund sits behind her microscope and doesn't see him until he touches her on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my God... Richard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I loaned you something once, Kath, and I need them back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sykes, dressed in coat and tie, prepares to leave apartment. Somewhere in the distance we hear: FIRE ENGINE SIRENS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cop stares at Sykes' window when suddenly we hear FIRE SIRENS, and a pair of fire trucks turn onto the street and pull up across the street from the unmarked car -blocking the view of Sykes' house. Firemen climb down and move to a nearby building. The street begins to fill up with people. The cop stares at the commotion directly behind him. He becomes so engrossed in the action like everyone else that he fails to see Sykes, using the distraction, exit his apartment and walk calmly away from the scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .S. MARSHAL'S OFFICE - DAY Newman studies the photograph of Lentz and Sykes under a magnifying glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see the logo on Lentz' shirt says: "C M H" EXT. EL STATION - PHONE BOOTH - DAY Sykes stands at a phone booth, finishes a call, then moves up the stairs to board an el train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A conference breaks up and Nichols moves down hallway. He slows when he sees Gerard and Renfro waiting for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Gerard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor. Could I have a minute? He opens the door to an empty meeting room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard, Nichols and Renfro. Nichols stares at a photo copy of the Sykes and Lentz fishing photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a security specialist at Devlin-Macgregor Pharmaceuticals. Kimble broke into his apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know him. You're getting pretty desperate aren't you, Mr. Gerard. I told you, you wouldn't find Richard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Kimble hasn't come back to you for help, has he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. And it seems like we've been over this ground before. Now if you'll excuse me. Nichols moves to the door. Gerard looks again at the photo, then stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Nichols. Do you know the other man in the photograph? Nichols stops, looks at Lentz and lies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never saw him before. He leaves. Gerard watches him. Renfro looks down and sees flyer which says Nichols is slated to talk that evening in the grand ballroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Advances in Nuclear Tissue and Pathology Research," by Dr. Charles Nichols. (to Gerard) I bet they line up to hear that one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Newman and Biggs enter the hospital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WAHLUND'S LAB - AFTERNOON MICROSCOPIC POV: Cell structure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She works the fluorescent stains. Makes notes. Kimble helps load the next sample.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Half the people in the study were indigents. No follow-up, no baseline on them. Who could say they didn't come into the study with bad livers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one on the right is one of the samples you sent me. It shows a lot of perriportal inflammation loaded with eosinophils. When you see that with the accumulation of bile it's a classic for -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - drug induced hepatitis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm impressed. Now look at this. She positions a second slide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: According to the study, this is a slice from the same liver. Kimble studies the slide. The tissue difference is markedly different, clearer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cold normal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clearly not from the same tissue. In fact. She yields the microscope to Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See this small area of bile duct proliferation? Von Meyenberg's Complex. Occurs in only 2% of the population. But it's in every one of your five samples. Kimble looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's statistically impossible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's because they're all from the same liver. She smiles at Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Newman shows the photo to a 40s clerk, BETTY. She looks at the photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His name's Lentz. A pathologist. I only remember him because he died last summer. Biggs and Newman exchange a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anybody down in pathology who might know something about the guy? Betty looks at the clock, it's after 6 p.m. Dicey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's kinda late to catch anyone, but you might go by the morgue. There's an old guy down there who's been around forever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sykes steps off an elevator at Chicago Memorial Hospital. And starts down a hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Newman and Biggs move down the empty hallway... this long shot has never felt longer. They find the morgue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just what I want to do before dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roosevelt working near the autopsy tables when the two marshals enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you Mr. Roosevelt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're United States Marshals. We're trying to find out some information about a pathologist, named Lentz. He used to be on staff here. Roosevelt suddenly goes on the defensive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, we heard. We wanted to know if he knew or had any contact with Dr. Richard Kimble? On the mention of Kimble, Roosevelt becomes visibly nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I haven't seen Dr. Kimble. Biggs and Newman exchange a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not what I asked, sir. I just wanted to know if Dr. Kimble and Dr. Lentz knew each other?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I don't know. Excuse me, I got to go. He moves away from the autopsy table. Biggs stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you're lying to us. Roosevelt looks from one marshal to the other as we:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WAHLUND'S LAB - AFTERNOON As Kathy packs up evidence, Kimble looks through the reports.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'd be home free if I hadn't been leaning on them to account for the livers I was seeing. And I wouldn't have seen the livers if I hadn't told the guys on my service to call me when they had cases that were bleeding excessively in surgery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big bucks. One schmuck standing in the way. Easy, get rid of him and his wife. But why Lentz?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not? He's one of the original patent holders. Toss the samples I sent, replace them with healthy samples, issue the path report on the healthy stuff-piece of cake. Kimble notices something in the report.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When did Lentz die?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, last summer sometime. August... Why? Kimble looks up from the protocol report.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because a good third of the samples Lentz approved were signed after he died. Kathy comes to look at the report. Lentz's signature is on reports dated October, November, December.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone else used Lentz's name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pathologist at Devlin-Macgregor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They wouldn't have had the access. They would have needed someone at the hospital. Kimble opens the Devlin-Macgregor prospectus he took from the medical library and opens it to the beginning. A photo gets his attention. He takes the bag and starts for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To see an old friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard at his board. The cards form a triangle: Sykes Devlin-Macgregor - Lentz with Kimble at the apex. He stares at the board. Poole comes to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Newman. Line two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble slips down corridor. We see someone following him. It is Sykes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Newman on portable phone. Behind him Biggs questions Mr. Roosevelt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The old guy didn't know where he was going. But he picked up some tissue samples.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tissue samples? Gerard goes to his board. Renfro listens on the speakerphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... From a drug study. And signed for by Dr. Charles Nichols. Renfro and Gerard exchange a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nichols also knew Lentz. He was a pathologist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was covering for Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get CPD to bring in Sykes. Gerard stares at the board.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble moves through steam tunnel beneath the hospital. It is lined with old furniture and supplies. A few moments later we see Sykes following.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A cordial HOST steps up to the microphone. The room is filled with doctors seated at tables around the room. It is the end of a dinner symposium.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tonight to close our conference, we're honored to hear a report from one of the most respected men in his field...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble exits the hospital and moves toward Hospital E1 Station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the Host continues his introduction of the keynote speaker we PAN the DAIS of distinguished medical men and women...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... He is the A. Jude Robinson Fellow and Administrative Chief of Pathology at Chicago Memorial Hospital... and just recently has been appointed member of the board of directors for Devlin-Macgregor Pharmaceuticals. Please welcome... ... and STOP ON Charles Nichols.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Dr. Charles Nichols. Nichols rises to applause and moves to the podium.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble starts up the stairs to the station just as a train is coming in. Kimble moves down the platform and boards the downtown train. Just before the doors close Sykes steps onto the last car. The train moves out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard stares at his board. Stevens comes to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I checked Sykes' calls for the last two years against Kimble's like you asked and found nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. It was a thought. He goes back to the board but Stevens isn't finished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But when I cross-checked Kimble's phone records... one came up. Gerard looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble called Sykes. (calling) Renfro! Get C.P.D. to bring in Sykes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Night of his wife's murder - seven-thirty in the evening from his car. Gerard stares at the deputy, thinking - something doesn't click. Stevens sees the empty stare, then Gerard looks back at his board.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have the phone record right here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poole! Bring me Kimble's arrest report, now. (to Stevens) No, Stevens... I believe you. Poole enters with Kimble's arrest transcript. Gerard takes the transcript as Renfro appears at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam, C.P.D. just checked Sykes' apartment. He's not there. As Gerard looks up, we -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sits in the front car. There are very few other riders. A man with newspaper sits across the car reading. The headlines facing Kimble say: "KIMBLE IN CHICAGO". Kimble's booking photo stares back at him. Kimble reacts to the headline, looks away as the man turns the pages. The man looks over the newspaper at Kimble, then goes back to reading. A moment later he folds the paper back to the front page. The man looks up from the paper and looks at Kimble again, then down. Coolly the man folds the paper, tucks it under his arm, stands, looks through the car, then moves into one of the rear cars. Kimble looks out the window - hoping desperately for his car to reach the station. He keeps his head turned until the man is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From the center of Kimble's car we see the man with the newspaper move up to a TRANSIT COP. They begin talking. Kimble stands, coming INTO the SHOT. We see him watching the discussion. Suddenly a man, sitting in the rear of the car, stands and blocks Kimble's view of the Cop. It's Sykes. His gun is drawn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back up. Move to the door, Doc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Transit Cop moves past the man with the newspaper toward Kimble's car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is transit unit, 23. I have a possible sighting of Richard Kimble. Northbound coming into the Balbo station. Request immediate back-up at the station. He moves toward the connecting door to Kimble's car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The train is not yet to the station. He has no escape. Sykes moves toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my stop, Doc. Kimble stares hard at Sykes. He steps toward the side exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good, it's my stop, too. Suddenly the door behind Sykes opens and the Transit Cop enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble. (to Sykes) Sir, move away from him. Sykes - the gun tucked next to his side - turns. The Cop sees Sykes' gun, reacts... But Sykes FIRES first, shoots the cop FOUR TIMES. As the Cop falls, Sykes turns quickly to finish Kimble. But Kimble pulls the emergency brake over the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The brakes lock. The TRAIN SCREECHES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Passengers are thrown off their feet. Bags and briefcases go flying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sykes is thrown forward toward Kimble who holds onto a bar for balance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The train stops just short of the station. Only the first two windows of the front car are over the platform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sykes is thrown to the floor - the gun slips from his grasp. Kimble moves for the gun as Sykes comes up, catches Kimble in the stomach, knocks him back. The fight carries on throughout the car. Kimble reaches the gun first, lifts it in his left hand and aims at Sykes. Sykes sees the gun in Kimble's hand and almost smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead. You don't have it in you . For a moment Kimble almost fires, but instead he takes the gun in his right hand and whips it across Sykes' face. Then hits Sykes again and again with the butt of the gun, driving him down the length of the car, knocking him almost unconscious. Kimble tucks the gun in his belt and moves to the Transit Cop. He checks for a pulse - there is none. The Cop is dead. Kimble takes the handcuffs and keys from the case on the Cop's belt. He reaches for Sykes' wrist, drags him to the Cop and cuffs Sykes to the dead Cop. He pockets the keys and grabs Sykes' hair, pulls his face off the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not as easy as Helen, was it? (slams Sykes' head down, leaves) You missed your stop. He moves to the front of the car with Sykes' and the Transit Cop's guns out. People back out of his way. He moves to where the first two windows extend over the platform, kicks out the front window and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... drops to the station platform. Kimble lowers his head and moves down the uncrowded platform to the station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The report comes off the scanner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... units in the vicinity of Balbo Street station. Be alert to possible sighting of Richard Kimble... Gerard, Renfro and Poole trade looks. Gerard moves toward the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Balbo station. That's -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poole, get Biggs and Newman. They're gone as we -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Police cruisers pull outside the station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As transit police move up the escalator to the platform, Kimble moves unnoticed through the underground mall beneath the hotel. Deposits the guns into a mail box and keeps moving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renfro driving, Gerard and Pool in car. Report comes over the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... all units in vicinity of Balbo E1. Officer down. Repeat, officer down. Man leaving scene with two guns matches description of Richard Kimble... Gerard looks out the window, he knows what this means.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble moves up escalators from the underground station into the Hilton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Disheveled and driven, he moves from the escalators to the lobby - checks the list of hospitality suites and sees board which indicates Nichols speech in the rooftop ballroom. He moves on to the main elevators.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nichols speaking. As he talks we MOVE TO...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listening - the same men we saw in the hospitality suite when Nichols talked to Kimble. As we MOVE TIGHTER ON one of the men, we notice his name tag says: Board of Directors... Devlin-MacGregor Pharmaceuticals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble rides alone to the rooftop ballroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard's car pulls up in front of the hotel. Police are controlling pedestrians. Newman and Biggs, already decked out in Kevlar, meet him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .P.D. just reported -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard. Was it Kimble?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Conflicting reports, but the cops are considering him a shooter. Heavily-armed CPD units pull up. Gerard stares at the police presence. He starts toward the hotel where Kelly is conferring with Kevlar-decked police captain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Witnesses say he entered hotel from the subway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. I want it locked down. Start on the lower levels. The captain moves off. Gerard intercepts the cop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's my man in there, Kelly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not since he took down one of ours, Gerard. This is a police matter, now. Stay, the hell, out of it. Kelly moves off. Gerard watches him a moment then he looks up to the roof. Newman hands Gerard his belt with his backup piece.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, I know where he's going. He moves into the hotel with his deputies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . / INT. HOTEL - NIGHT A) C.P.D. cruisers arriving. Cops deploying to points of entry. Security guards keying shut parking garage and blocking stairwells. B) Helicopter with police sharpshooters takes off from Meigs Field downtown and heads for the hotel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble exits the elevators and moves down the corridor to the ballroom. A man tries to stop him at the doors, Kimble simply moves him out of the way and opens the doors to:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nichols moves to the last of his speech as Kimble enters at the rear
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... And I especially would like to thank my researchers who helped me... Nichols stops his speech - stunned to see Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong, Charlie? Surprised? Kimble begins moving down the aisle past the tables of doctors toward the podium. We see the faces of Kimble's colleagues and friends from the ballroom sequence earlier. At first no one notices Kimble but as he makes his way toward the dais, the applause fades and then room quiets. Whispers of:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Richard. It's Kimble. Stunned expressions. Kimble continues to the front, talking to Nichols as if the room were empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After Lentz died, you were the only one that had access to the pathology reports. Nichols remains calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reports? What are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You switched the samples and falsified the reports so R.D.U.90 could get approval.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard, I don't know what you're talking about?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a set of the original samples. Nichols stares at Kimble and for the first time we see a flicker of concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You almost pulled it off, Charlie. But I know all about it now, and I can prove it. Nichols and Kimble hold a look. Nichols turns to the audience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ladies and gentlemen. My friend, as you can see, is obviously not well. Richard, if you want to talk -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't come here to talk Nichols leaves the dais and heads toward the exit. Kimble tracks along with him - moving through the tables - passing the table with the Devlin-MacGregor board of directors. They are disturbed by this situation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moves through a door and exits into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble follows moving through the tables and people to reach the door. As soon as he's gone there are calls for "security." Doctors move for the exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard, Renfro, Newman, Biggs and Poole move into the lobby. Police move to cover the lower floors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .P.D. has the perimeter, hotel security has the parking structure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let them keep busy down below. Newman, get with security. See if you can locate Kimble from the monitors. Keep in radio contact. Newman branches off to Hotel Security. The rest follow Gerard to the rooftop elevators.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: over Chicago skyline. The bright red sign of the Hilton Hotel looms ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nichols moves down hallway and turns into a hospitality suite. A moment later Kimble follow and enters the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and is immediately smashed with a chair by Nichols. Kimble goes flying, stunned. Nichols locks the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your best quality, Richard, is that you don't give up - Nichols pulls Kimble to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... even when it's clearly in your best interest to... He hits him again, drives him back into the library. Kimble tries to recover as Nichols relentlessly stays on him. He pulls him up, slams him against the fire escape doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I always knew that I'd have to kill you. He drives a blow into Kimble's stomach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, I must thank you for giving me 200 witnesses tonight who will support me... when I tell them it was self-defense... He shoves Kimble through the door out into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and almost over the railing. Kimble grabs the rail to keep from dropping to the street. Nichols closes on him, but Kimble rolls away at the last minute and knocks Nichols back against the other side of fire escape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You missed your chance, Charlie... Nichols charges Kimble, but Kimble drives him back with two crushing blows that send Nichols down the stairs. Kimble moves down the stairs after him - passing under a security camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A room lined with security monitors. Two security personnel sit in front of their console. Newman stands behind them. On screen: We see Kimble moving down the stairs toward Nichols, who pulls himself to his feet. Newman stands in front of the screen, talks to his radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got Kimble on the roof with Nichols. Southeast exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard and deputies Poole, Biggs, and Renfro around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep and eye on him. Biggs has roof plans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are four exits to the roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want them covered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nichols rises to his feet, swings, but Kimble blocks the blow and lands another that sends Nichols down another set of stairs to the roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You took everything away from me... for money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard and the marshals reach the ballroom floor. The elevator doors open to a flood of confused and disoriented doctors trying to escape. The marshals wade through, meet up with two hotel security guards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble pulls Nichols to his feet. They are silhouetted by the lights of the city skyline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to know, Charlie... was it worth it...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This thing is bigger than even you think, Richard. You can't stop it. He hits Nichols again with tremendous force, knocking him against the parapet. Nichols stares over the edge - the street appears far below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard and his deputies work their way into the ballroom. The deputies move to separate areas. Several doctors point them in the direction Kimble and Nichols fled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Newman stands in front the security monitors and watches Kimble and Nichols on the roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble reaches Nichols and draws to hit him again as the HELICOPTER suddenly ROARS over the rooftop. Its beam hits the two men and a VOICE booms from the helicopter:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chicago police. Freeze. In the instant of shock, Nichols knees Kimble and bolts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard moves down connecting hallway where a couple of concerned doctors are trying to open the door to the hospitality suite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clear the hallway. (to security) Get that door open. The door opens and Gerard moves quickly through the hospitality suite for the rooftop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay at this door. He moves through the door to the roof alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Newman watching the security monitors sees Kimble and Nichols. On another monitor we see Gerard exit the suite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nichols runs. Kimble recovers, sees Gerard moving down the fire escape toward him, and Nichols escaping. He goes after Nichols. The helicopter circles back over the roof, illuminating the rooftop in its million-candle-power beam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got a visual on Kimble. He's running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly listens on his ratio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring him down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble chases Nichols down the roof as BULLETS from the helicopter rip into the air conditioning duct next to Kimble. The helicopter swings out to keep Kimble in sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard hits the bottom of the fire escape and follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a United States Marshal. Get that helicopter out of here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves away among the duct work. Kimble follows. Gerard continues after Kimble. The helicopter circles and follows from above.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Renfro triggers his radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a U.S. Marshal out there. Hold your fire!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FOLLOWING Kimble. Its beam tracking Kimble across the rooftop. He moves through the blowers and duct work. Kimble is gaining ground on Nichols.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is about to fire when he hears through his radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold your fire. The shooter pulls back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard rushes across the roof toward Kimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is almost to the end of the roof when Kimble tackles him. The two men crash against sloped glass roof of an elevator housing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inside the shaft - an elevator moves toward the roof. It stops on the floor ten feet below the roof. THROUGH the glass roof we see the doors open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charges toward -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who slams Nichols hard against the glass. The WIRED GLASS CRACKS and bellies with the form of their bodies. Nichols' head rocks from the impact. The GLASS GROANS. The wire stresses. The caulking begins to drop. Nichols struggles but Kimble has him in control. Slams him down hard again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Circles, illuminates the struggle in its spotlight and Gerard closing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The elevator doors close and the car beneath the skylight begins to descend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pulls up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble! Kimble slams Nichols one more time against the glass and the wire holding the glass gives way, sending Kimble and Nichols into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble and Nichols, locked together, fall down the shaft and crash onto the roof of the descending elevator car. Nichols crashes through the ceiling into the car. Kimble hits and slides across the roof to the edge, stopping himself, just before he falls into the shaft. An elevator car rushes toward him out of the blackness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard reaches the elevator housing, looks down into the shaft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble's car disappears into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nichols pulls himself to his feet. Hits the emergency stop and the doors open. He disappears into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... a huge industrial laundry room. Steam rises from the giant machines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble drops from the ceiling into the car and moves carefully into the laundry. ... like an industrial jungle. Dimly lit, filled with DEAFENING MACHINERY. Five hundred pound bags of laundry move from a network of ceiling tracks to a pair of heavyduty conveyor belts and two thirty-foot long washers. ...
