At the other end of the washers, hydraulic presses stamp out three-foot diameter "cakes" which are moved by conveyor and dollies to automated dryers. The NOISE is DEAFENING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard comes down back stairwell. Followed by Renfro.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where did the elevator stop?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Newman checks the computer board for the elevator position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Level five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nichols pushes through the hanging laundry bags toward an exit, tries the door. It is secured with a collapsible grating with a padlock. He looks up, keeps moving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Notices the swinging bags, follows Nichols' trail. He stops to get his bearings, sees shadow at the far end of the room between the two washers. Kimble closes in, moving between the large conveyors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gerard enters sorting room with Renfro. He sees two sorters standing by a small conveyor as he enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out of here. He and Renfro move around the corner where a laundry worker is hooking a 500 lb bag of lines onto the overhead rail. A hydraulic lift, operated by a hanging on/off switch raises the bag on a yellow steel I-beam. The worker takes one look at Gerard and abandons his station. Gerard, Biggs and Renfro move to the closed doors of the main room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going in. Give me five minutes. Keep C.P.D. out. He draws his Glock, opens the door and enters the main room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves to end of washers, using the machines as cover. He sees the shadow again takes a pole leaning against the dryer as a weapon, turns the corner and is about to belt him when he realizes it's not Nichols, but a laundry worker. Kimble moves away from the terrified man, when he hears a voice from the other end of the laundry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble! Kimble reacts to Gerard's voice, moves away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moving behind machinery, sees light at far end of the room where Gerard enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door closes automatically behind Gerard and Renfro. They enter the noisy main room and separate. Renfro moves up the far side of the room, Gerard up the center. Both move slowly through the maze of bags, carts, automated equipment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... There is no way out of here. The building is locked down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moves instinctively back into the machinery and carts near the conveyor belts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble... I know about Nichols. I know about Sykes. Kimble stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Nichols borrowed your car the night of the murder and called Sykes from it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Separated from Gerard. He hears a NOISE behind him - a bag comes down the track at break-neck speed, Renfro spins, dodges it, gets his bearings and continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listening. He watches the movement of bags as he did with Nichols.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moving through the forest of massive bags.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... That's why there was no forced entry at your house. He'd used your keys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Realizing what Gerard knows. Considering his next move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Also listening. He realizes Gerard now knows he's the killer. He moves behind the water softener tanks and chemicals - and spots Renfro - and something else -the hanging control for the I-beam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moves carefully. Another bag comes down the track. He dodges it and steps into an open track. From here he can see straight back toward the washers. GERARD Kimble... Come meet me out here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He steps out and then back as a bag shoots by. He ducks under the bag - into the next track and suddenly hears a WHIRRING sound behind him. Renfro turns as an I-beam comes rushing down the open track and knocks him to the floor, opening a gash across the side of his head. He lays still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steps out of the shadows, turns him over exposing his empty shoulder harness and takes the gun from Renfro's hand. Nichols moves toward Gerard with the gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oblivious to this action, moves on, passes the conveyor belts. He makes one last appeal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's time to quit running... if you don't, you know I'll stop you. He listens, there is no answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Starts to move out to meet Gerard, sees Renfro down. His shoulder harness is empty. He knows Nichols is armed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moves into the alley between the two giant washers. He pauses, looks back, then continues, when he turns his back on us...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steps INTO FRAME behind him and slowly takes aim. Just before he fires however he hears...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Chuckles... Nichols turns toward the voice as Kimble swings the stick and clocks him - sending the gun skittering on the floor behind Gerard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turns on the sound and finds his gun trained on Kimble with Nichols at his feet, unconscious. He realizes instantly that Kimble saved his life and lowers his gun. Kimble, exhausted, leans against the washer. They hold a look as deputies and police flood into the room surrounding Kimble and handcuffing him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chicago Police hold back crowds of onlookers on Michigan Avenue. Police cars and vans, television news trucks vie for space in front of the Hilton Towers. Dr. Charles Nichols, on a stretcher, loaded into an ambulance. The doors close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and television cameramen line the sidewalk giving reports and interviewing doctors from the ballroom. We PICK UP pieces of their reports as we MOVE PAST them TOWARD the entrance. T.V. NEWS REPORTER ... As we reported a few minutes ago, the saga of once-prominent Chicago surgeon, Dr. Richard Kimble, who escaped from an Illinois Corrections bus, took a strange twist this evening when Dr. Kimble was captured at the Chicago Hilton...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: continues:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... there are unconfirmed reports from police of new evidence which may exonerate Kimble while implicating some of the biggest names in medicine... The doors to the police van close amid a flurry of photographs. A third reporter interviews a STUNNED DOCTOR from the ballroom:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He just walked in... We didn't know what he was going to do. My wife was very frightened... The next thing I knew cops were charging in and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kimble, in handcuffs, is escorted by Biggs, Newman, Poole and Gerard, out of the hotel into the waiting chaos. Renfro, his head bandaged, is helped by paramedics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAR - NIGHT As soon as the group exits the hotel. Television lights flood the scene. Kimble lowers his head. Reporters crowd forward, yelling questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Kimble, is it true you can prove your innocence! Gerard wants the crowd controlled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get them back. The marshals ant cops clear a line for Kimble to get into a waiting car away from the media. Biggs opens the back door and helps Kimble inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch your head, Dr. Kimble. Newman climbs in behind the wheel. Gerard in the back next to Kimble. He leans out the window and motions to Poole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poole, you got that thing? (to Kimble) Give me your hands. Kimble pauses, then holds up his wrists and Gerard unlocks Kimble's handcuffs. Poole hands an ice-pack over the seat. Gerard places the pack on Kimble' 9 bruised and battered hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take care of those hands, Doc, you're going to need them again soon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you told me 'you didn't care.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, don't spread it around. They share a look of mutual respect as the car pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The car carrying Kimble pulls onto Michigan Avenue heading back downtown. As we PULL BACK we see Kimble's car - at first alone on the great avenue - then gradually joined by other cars until finally becoming integrated in the traffic, movement and lights of the city.
direction.name: direction
